Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA) is located in Northwest Arkansas and offers a range of flights from six different airlines: Allegiant Air, American Airlines, Breeze Airways, Delta Air Lines, Frontier Airlines, and United Airlines. Low-cost carriers Allegiant Air, Breeze Airways, and Frontier Airlines often bring fares down for the other three airlines. Allegiant Air, Breeze Airways, and Frontier Airlines are all low-cost carriers and periodically bring fares for the other three airlines down, sometimes by creating competition. 

Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA) currently has 22 nonstop flights to various destinations, including Atlanta, Austin, Charlotte, Chicago, Dallas, Denver, Destin/Fort Walton, Fort Lauderdale, Houston, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Miami, Minneapolis, Nashville, New Orleans, New York City, Orlando/Sanford, Phoenix/Mesa, Punta Gorda, St Pete/Clearwater, and Tampa.

By Airline: 

Allegiant 

Allegiant Air offers flights from Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA) to Austin (AUS), Destin/Fort Walton (VPS), Fort Lauderdale (FLL), Las Vegas (LAS), Los Angeles (LAX), Nashville (BNA), Orlando/Sanford (SFB), Phoenix/Mesa (AZA), Punta Gorda (PGD), and St Pete/Clearwater (PIE)

American 

﻿

American Airlines offers flights from Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA) to Charlotte (CLT), Chicago (ORD), Dallas Fort Worth (DFW), Los Angeles (LAX), Miami (MIA), New York City (LGA), and Washington DC (DCA).

Breeze 

﻿

Breeze Airways offers flights from Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA) to New Orleans (MSY) and Tampa (TPA).

Delta 

﻿

Delta Air Lines offers flights from Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA) to Atlanta (ATL), Minneapolis (MSP), and New York City (LGA).

Frontier 

﻿

Frontier Airlines offers flights from Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA) to Denver (DEN) and Las Vegas (LAS).

United 

United Airlines offers flights from Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA) to Chicago (ORD), Denver (DEN), and Houston (IAH).

Stay up to date

Airfares change with the economy, and schedules shift depending on the season. Fare Flight NWA is the region’s resource for the most insightful up-to-date information regarding all things traveling with Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA). 

If you’re trying to figure out if you should fly out of Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA) or travel to the next closest airport, be sure to use Fare Flight’s Cost Calculator to see which option is most sustainable for you!
node.title: NWA Daily's Northwest Arkansas National Airport Route Guide
node.description: Find your next flight from Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA). With service from six airlines flying out of Northwest Arkansas, including low-cost carriers Allegiant Air, Breeze Airways, and Frontier Airlines, you can choose the best option for your travel plans. XNA offers 22 nonstop flights to destinations across the United States.

node.content:
Welcome to Rogers, Arkansas, home to a variety of beautiful parks that offer a range of recreational activities for visitors of all ages. One of the most popular parks in the area is Hobbs State Park-Conservation Area, the largest state park in Arkansas, spanning 12,054 acres of Ozark landscape along the southern shore of Beaver Lake. The park offers a 54-mile trail system with hiking, mountain biking, and horseback riding trails, as well as primitive campsites. Another popular spot is Lake Atalanta Park & Trails, a 236-acre park that includes the Railyard Bike Park, fishing lake, off-road bike trail, pavilion, picnic areas, playground, and more. Railyard Park is also a must visit spot for its fun playground, splash pad, and picnic tables, and the Butterfield Stage where Railyard Live takes place.

Rogers

Hobbs State Park-Conservation Area

📍20201 E Hwy 12

NWA Daily

Hobbs is Arkansas' largest state park, and it's right here in our backyard!! It spans 12,054 acres of Ozark landscape along the southern shore of Beaver Lake. The park is for day use and includes a 54-mile trail system with hiking, ADA accessible, mountain biking, and horseback riding trails. There are 11 primitive campsites and six are accessible by mountain biking only.

Facebook


Lake Atalanta Park & Trails

📍500 E Walnut St.

Photo courtesy of the City of Rogers

Lake Atalanta Park is a 236-acre park that includes the Railyard Bike Park. There is a fishing lake, an off-road bike trail, a paved stone walkway, a pavilion, picnic areas, a unique playground, and much more. We love going here for a nature walk and it's perfect for an outing with the kids!

Facebook


Railyard Park

📍216 S 1st St

NWA Daily

The Railyard Park is such a fun spot in Downtown Rogers! Primarily a play place and splash pad for kids, it's right next to the Frisco Plaza which is lined with picnic tables, and the Butterfield Stage where Railyard Live takes place.

Rogers, Arkansas offers a wide range of beautiful parks that cater to different interests and activities. Whether you're looking for a place to hike, bike, fish, or simply enjoy nature, you can find it in one of Rogers' many parks. Hobbs State Park-Conservation Area and Lake Atalanta Park & Trails are must-visit spots for nature lovers and adventure seekers. Railyard Park is perfect for a fun day out with the kids and family. With so much to offer, Rogers' parks are the perfect destination for an outdoor adventure and a chance to enjoy the beauty of nature. So don't wait any longer, come and explore the great outdoors in Rogers today.
node.title: NWA Daily's Guide to Parks in Rogers, AR
node.description: Explore the natural beauty of Rogers, Arkansas with a visit to one of the city's many beautiful and diverse parks. From Hobbs State Park-Conservation Area's 54-mile trail system and primitive campsites to Lake Atalanta Park & Trails's fishing lake, off-road bike trail, and playground, there's something for everyone. Railyard Park is perfect for a fun day out with the kids, with a playground and splash pad. Discover the hidden gems of Northwest Arkansas and enjoy a variety of recreational activities such as hiking, biking, fishing, picnicking and more. Visit Rogers' parks today and explore the beauty of nature

node.content:
Feel like you don't know all the best coffee shops in Fayetteville? Look no further, because Fayetteville, Arkansas has some seriously amazing options for your caffeine fix. From cozy spots to work or hang out with friends, to late night weekend hangouts and even a drive-thru option, there's something for everyone. And let's not forget about the delicious food options - avocado toast, breakfast tacos, and even waffles! So whether you're a local or just passing through, make sure to check out these amazing Fayetteville coffee shops for a truly memorable caffeine experience.

Fayetteville

Onyx Coffee Lab

📍2418 N. Greg Ave.

Photo courtesy of Onyx

The OG - Onyx's Fayetteville location is where it all started. It is a great, quick spot for a cup of quality coffee and a reflection back at Onyx's humble beginning. Zero frills and strictly good coffee.

Instagram - Facebook


Puritan Coffee & Beer

📍205 W Dickson St

Puritan is your classic modern coffee shop with plenty of space to sit and work or play games with friends. It is in a perfect location on the top of Dickson Street with a great selection of beers and ciders too. They have a legendary trivia night!

Instagram - Facebook


Red Kite Company

📍1852 N Crossover Rd

Photo courtesy of Red Kite

A super cozy coffee shop that sells exclusively Onyx coffee. A great place to study or just hang out on the east side of town. Rumor is their expanding to Benton County soon so keep an eye out as Red Kite plans to make some moves!

Facebook


Old Pine

📍3775 Mall Ave

Photo courtesy of Old Pine

Located on a spur of the Razorback Greenway, Old Pine is a cozy spot and traditionally quieter as its a bit further from campus. On a beautiful morning their outdoor patio is the place to be. The avocado toast is a solid choice - we would recommend.

Instagram - Facebook


Arsaga's

📍481 S. School Ave

📍200 W. Center St.

📍1509 MLK Jr. Blvd

📍401 W. Mountain St.

With 4 locations in Fayetteville each Arsaga's location is a different experience. Take your friends to the Mill District and have a fancy breakfast or brunch with your coffee in an artsy cafe. Church & Center is calm and comfy, and of course Carsaga's is perfect for a quick one to-go. The fourth location just reopened and can be found in the Fayetteville Public Library.

Instagram - Facebook


Basecamp

📍2850 N College Ave

Photo courtesy of Basecamp

Originally known as Mama Carman's, now Basecamp is an open and spacious place off College with plenty of places to sit to work or catch up with a friend. They have the classic toast and pastry options too.

Instagram - Facebook


Doomsday Coffee & Roasterie

📍436 W Watson St

Photo courtesy of Doomsday

Located off West Street near downtown Fayetteville, Doomsday Coffee is owned and operated by veterans with REALLY tasty breakfast and lunch tacos. They're open 7 days a week for breakfast and lunch and are often overlooked, but shouldn't be.

Instagram - Facebook


Lift Coffee Bar

📍3959 N Steele Blvd

Photo courtesy of Lift

Located in uptown Fayetteville, Lift Coffee Bar helps meet the caffeine cravings of north Fayetteville. Open late on weekends, this is an ideal location for coffee nightcap. Definitely go with an empty stomach so you can try their delicious menu items. The waffles are great!

Instagram - Facebook


Locals Drive Thru Coffee

📍2626 E Citizens Dr

Photo courtesy of Locals Drive Thru Coffee

Locals Drive Thru Coffee serves locally roasted, specialty coffee with speed and convenience. Locals has a mission to treat everyone in such a way that they "leave better." You can get any quality coffee and specialty drink, just a little faster, and know you're contributing to a hyper local business. When you go, try the cinnamon toast crunch latte!

Instagram - Facebook

Whether you're looking for a cozy spot to study or a quick caffeine fix on the go, Fayetteville has plenty of options for coffee lovers. From the classic Onyx Coffee Lab to the trendy Lift Coffee Bar, there's something for everyone's taste. Don't forget to try some of the local roasters, like Doomsday Coffee and Locals Drive Thru Coffee, for a truly unique experience. With so many great options, it's easy to find your perfect cup of coffee in Fayetteville.
node.title: NWA Daily's Guide to Coffee Shops in Fayetteville, AR
node.description: Looking for the best coffee shops in Fayetteville, Arkansas? Look no further! From cozy small-town vibes at Red Kite Company to late-night options at Lift Coffee Bar, we've got you covered with a list of the top coffee shops in the area. Whether you're in need of a quick caffeine fix or a place to work or relax, these locally-owned coffee shops offer something for everyone. Check out our list and find your new favorite spot for a cup of joe in Fayetteville.

node.content:
Are you looking for a tasty brunch spot in Bentonville? Look no further! From classic southern dishes to creative twists on traditional meals, Bentonville has something for everyone. Whether you're looking for a fancy brunch with beautiful views or a casual spot to grab a bite with friends, these restaurants are sure to impress. From the Fried Chicken and Bubbles combo at The Hive to the la Classic Crepe at Crepes Paulette, these brunch spots have something for everyone to enjoy. So grab your friends, family, or a good book, and head to one of these delicious brunch spots in Bentonville!

Bentonville

 The Hive

📍200 NE A St

Photo Courtesy of The Hive

Located inside the award-winning 21c Hotel Museum, The Hive prides itself on creativity and innovation, showcasing some of Arkansas’ classic culinary features in new and exciting ways. Try the Fried Chicken and Bubbles combo (chicken & biscuits with your choice of 3 fruit juices to add to bubbly wine) or something more traditional like the French toast entree.

Instagram - Facebook


Louise

📍2205 SW I St.

Photo Courtesy of Louise

Named after Iris Louise McPhetridge Thaden, one of the greatest aviatrixes of all time, Louise Thaden serves phenomenal fresh food with incredible views of the airfield. Bring the kids for a fun morning watching the planes take off and land, or bring a book and hang out while you try the OZ1 Omelet!

Instagram - Facebook


Table Mesa (Weekend)

📍110 East W Central Ave.

Photo Courtesy of Table Mesa

After you’ve done your farmer’s market shopping, pop into Table Mesa for what might become your favorite brunch place in Bentonville! If you’re looking for a unique experience for a special occasion or just a classy morning adventure, Table Mesa’s Sunday brunch might be right up your alley. Brunch starts at 8a and ends at 11a.

Instagram - Facebook


Crepes Paulette

📍100 SW 8th St.

Photo Courtesy of Crepes Paulette

If you’re looking for something new and handheld for brunch, check out the la Classic or the la Spinach crêpes from Crêpes Paulette, or if you’re looking for something sweeter for brunch try the fan-favorite Nutella and banana crêpe! A crêpe in one hand, mimosa in the other, soaking in the sunshine, can a morning get any better?

Instagram - Facebook


 Pressroom (Weekend)

📍100 NW 2nd St.

Photo Courtesy of Pressroom

Don’t miss out on Pressroom’s weekend brunch specials, packed with options for those wanting to lean towards the breakfast side or the lunch side of brunch with fantastic shareable plates to bring the table together. Relax into Pressroom’s atmosphere and bring the whole table together this weekend.

Instagram - Facebook

Bentonville has a lot to offer when it comes to brunch options. From classic southern fried chicken and biscuits at The Hive, to unique crêpes at Crepes Paulette, there's something for everyone. Take in the beautiful views of the airfield at Louise, or relax with a mimosa at Table Mesa. Whether you're looking for a casual brunch or a special occasion, these spots are sure to please. So gather your friends and family, and head out to explore the brunch scene in Bentonville!
node.title: NWA Daily's Guide to Brunch in Bentonville, AR
node.description: Discover the best brunch spots in Bentonville, Arkansas! From The Hive's creative and innovative dishes to Crepes Paulette's delicious crêpes, these restaurants offer a unique and delicious brunch experience. Whether it's a special occasion or just a casual morning adventure, these brunch options are sure to impress. Get your taste buds ready for a culinary journey with our guide to Bentonville's brunch scene.

node.content:
Welcome to Fayetteville, home to some of the best pizza joints in Arkansas! Whether you're in the mood for deep dish, thin crust, wood-fired, or stuffed, we've got you covered. From the cozy, authentic Italian vibes at Geraldi's to the trendy, specialty pizzas and cocktails at Wood Stone Craft Pizza, there's something for every pizza lover in Fayetteville. Don't forget to check out Damgoode Pies for their delicious "stuffy" pepperoni pies with pink sauce, or Mojo's Pints & Pies for their hearty pizzas and great sports-watching patio. And for those Chicago deep dish cravings, Marley's Pizzeria & Bar has you covered. So come on down and satisfy your pizza craving at one of these fantastic pizza places in Fayetteville, Arkansas.

Wood Stone Craft Pizza

📍 Fayetteville (Uptown) - 3619 Mall Ave

📍 Fayetteville (S Town) - 557 S School Ave

Photo courtesy of Woodstone Craft Pizza

Located in both North and South Fayetteville, featuring fun and trendy atmospheres. They offer speciality pizzas and cocktails. Our go to is the wedge salad, Bloomington pizza, and pomegranate margarita. Don’t forget to try the bone sauces for dipping! The Uptown location has an amazing new patio addition for great outdoor dining.

Instagram, Facebook


Damgoode Pies

📍 37 E Center Street

Photo courtesy of Damgoode Pies

Fun location right off the square with a casual environment. Their traditional and specialty pies are both great, and they offer draft beer. We highly recommend the pepperoni “stuffy” with pink sauce.

Instagram, Facebook


US Pizza Company

📍 202 W Dickson Street

Photo courtesy of US Pizza

This is the ideal place for pizza after a football game. They have a great patio right on Dickson Street with homemade ranch that is to die for. The classic pizza is great, but you can also spice it up with a variety of cool flavor combinations.

Instagram, Facebook


Bocca Italian Eatery & Pizzeria

📍 2036 N College Ave

Photo courtesy of Bocca Italian

This nicer location has homemade everything! Woodfire pizza and plenty of roasted garlic! They also offer other Italian options if you want some variety.. try any of the homemade pastas or the steak!

Instagram, Facebook


Z's Brick Oven Pizza

📍 2730 N College Ave

Photo courtesy of Z's Brick Oven Pizza

Enjoy Brick Oven Pizza, delicious sandwiches, Grandmother's pasta dishes and tasty salads while dining in at Z's! The cozy fireplace is an excellent spot to enjoy beer or wine with your meal.

Instagram, Facebook


Marley's Pizzeria & Bar

📍 609 W Dickson Street #103

Photo courtesy of Marley's Pizzeria & Bar

Deep dish pizza that makes you feel like you are in Chicago. Located just off of Dickson Street, it is in the heart of downtown but slightly tucked away. The apps and wings are good too!

Instagram, Facebook


Tiny Tim's Pizza

📍 21 W Mountain Street

Photo courtesy of Tiny Tim's

Located on the Fayetteville square the thin crust pizza is amazing with great lunch portions. Don’t forget a side of their homemade ranch!

Instagram


Tim's Pizza East

📍 1813 E Mission Blvd

Photo courtesy of NWA Daily

This family owned and operated pizza joint is a staple in East Fayetteville. They are known for their pizzas being packed with flavor with lots of cheese!


Wicked Wood Fire Pizza

📍 1946 N Birch Ave

Photo courtesy of Wicked Wood Fire Pizza

This is one of the favorites in Fayetteville. Right outside of Fossil Cove, a fantastic brewery, this food truck has some of the best wood fired pizza in the area. Our favorite is the Honey Pig for the perfect balance of spicy and sweet.

*Closed on Mondays

Instagram, Facebook


Geraldi's

📍 20 S University Ave

Photo courtesy of Geraldi's

Cozy, authentic, Italian vibes. They offer thick crust pizza and calzones with plenty of other amazing options for non-pizza people.. try the lasagna or traditional spaghetti and meatballs!

Instagram, Facebook


Mellow Mushroom Fayetteville

📍 1460 E Augustine Ln

Photo courtesy of Mellow Mushroom

Located near uptown Fayetteville, they are perfect for large groups. Their thick crust pizza has a great mix of artisanal and original flavors. Half priced Pizza on Wednesdays!

Instagram, Facebook


Mojo’s Pints & Pies

📍 2630 East Citizens Dr.

Photo courtesy of Mojo's Pints and Pies

A newly opened location in East Fayetteville that offers a great patio and hearty pizzas! A great place to watch sports with a full bar and plenty of TVs - inside and out.

Instagram, Facebook


Gusano’s

📍 1267 Steamboat Dr

Photo courtesy of Gusano's

Specializing in Chicago style pizza, they have several locations scattered around NWA. They offer trivia nights on Wednesday and happy hour all day Thursday, plus additional specials offered most other days. Check out their monthly event calendar to see what fun activities are happening.

Instagram, Facebook


Tony’s New York Style Pizza

📍 412 W Dickson St

Photo courtesy of Tony's New York Style Pizza

Located on Dickson Street and staying open late on weekends makes for the perfect late night treat. Want pizza but don’t want a whole pizza? This is the place for you.

Facebook


Loafin Joe's

📍 201 W Mountain St

Photo courtesy of Loafin Joe's

Located right off of the square is this great lunch spot with amazing thin or thick crust pizza, plus hearty sandwiches if you’re not feeling pizza. Don’t forget to try their legendary homemade chips!

Instagram, Facebook

Thanks for joining us on this tasty tour of the best pizza joints in Fayetteville, Arkansas! Whether you're a fan of deep dish, thin crust, wood-fired, or stuffed, these pizzerias have something for every pizza lover. So next time you're craving a slice (or an entire pie) in Fayetteville, be sure to check out one of these fantastic pizzerias. From the cozy, authentic Italian vibes at Geraldi's to the trendy, specialty pizzas and cocktails at Wood Stone Craft Pizza, there's something for everyone in Fayetteville. So grab a slice (or a whole pie) and enjoy some of the best pizza in Arkansas!
node.title: Guide to Pizza in Fayetteville, Arkansas
node.description: Looking for the best pizza in Fayetteville, Arkansas? Look no further! From wood-fired pizzas at Wicked Wood Fire Pizza to deep dish at Marley's Pizzeria & Bar, we've got you covered. Check out our list of top pizzerias in Fayetteville for all your pizza cravings. Whether you're in the mood for traditional or specialty pies, thin or thick crust, or just some delicious homemade ranch, these Fayetteville pizzerias have it all. So come on down and enjoy some of the best pizza in Arkansas!

node.content:
Over the last decade, disc golf has rapidly grown in popularity both for recreation and as a highly competitive pro sport. NW Arkansas is home to some great disc golf courses, some often hosting nationally sanctioned PDGA tournaments. Whether you’re an aspiring pro or completely new to the sport, here’s a guide to some of the NWA’s best disc golf courses from north to south. 


Best Scenery: Branchwood Park in Bella Vista 

📍222 Glasgow Rd, Bella Vista, AR

Photo courtesy of Bella Vista POA

Branchwood takes the cake on most scenic disc golf course around NW Arkansas. With 18 holes along the beautiful Branchwood Nature Trail, this course was built on an old ball golf course and has some fun holes over the rolling greens. It’s especially beautiful in the spring time. 

  • 18 holes
  • DISCatcher Pro Targets
  • Concrete Tees


Best For Variety: Twin Creek in Rogers

📍2300 S Dixieland Rd, Rogers, AR

Photo courtesy of The City of Rogers

Located next to Rogers High School, Twin Creek is a long, moderately difficult course with a good amount of variety for mixed skill levels. There’s been construction in and around the course the last few years that has made the layout a bit confusing, but it received improved signage and new tees in the spring of 2022 that has helped a lot! 

  • 18 holes
  • Veteran & Monkey Trap Targets
  • Concrete, Grass Tees



Overall Nicest: J. Beast in Springdale 

📍2003 Fleming Dr, Springdale, AR 

Photo courtesy of Dynamic Discs NWA

A crowd favorite for the area, J. Beast is a fantastic 18-hole course with consistently well-kept grass, long fairways, and a few challengers through the woods. There’s a great Dynamic Discs shop on the property and a 9-hole junior course next door. There's currently a new 18-hole course being planned for the park property that is sure to be another top course in NWA.

  • 18 holes
  • DISCatcher Pro Targets
  • Concrete Tees 


Most Classic: North Shore in Springdale

📍1153 Lake Fayetteville Rd, Springdale, AR

Photo courtesy of Fayetteville Parks & Recreation

One of the oldest courses in NWA, North Shore offers a great mix of open and wooded holes around beautiful Lake Fayetteville. The pins alternate seasonally, providing a little bit of variety. The grass is maintained less frequently and can get a little tall in the summer and the fields can be pretty swampy for a few days after a rain, but everyone ought to play it. It feels like the area’s O.G. course. 

  • 18 holes
  • DISCatcher Pro Targets
  • Concrete Tees 



Most Infuriating: Waxhaws in Fayetteville 

📍855 S Block Ave, Fayetteville, AR

Photo courtesy of Fayetteville Parks & Recreation

Folks either love it or absolutely hate it, but you’ve got to appreciate a challenge. Waxhaws at Walker Park is probably the most tightly wooded course in NWA with hardly any open fairways. So if you’re not accurate, you’ll be kicking off trees all day, and it can stay fairly muddy for a while after it rains because it is so shaded. Almost guaranteed to get you heated, this is still a must-play course and can be really fun with the right group. 

  • 18 holes 
  • Titan Pro-24 Targets 
  • Concrete Tees



Best Challenge: Creekside in Farmington

📍54 N Hunter St, Farmington, AR 

Photo courtesy of City of Farmington

One of the more challenging courses, Creekside has a few holes with some serious distance, though there’s an alternate layout with shorter tees. This course has well-kept open fairways and a few densely wooded challenges. This course brings a consistent challenge for seasoned players, but is still fun and accessible for newcomers! 

  • 18 holes
  • Veteran Targets
  • Concrete Tees
node.title: NWA Daily’s Disc Golf Course Guide
node.description: Looking to get into disc golf or new to the area and wondering where to play? NWA Daily's Disc Golf Course Guide will give you some direction on where to go sling some plastic around Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale and Fayetteville.

node.content:
Looking for some delicious pizza in Bentonville, Arkansas? Look no further! From the artisan-crafted, Neapolitan-style pizzas at Priato Pizzeria to the wood-fired pies at Pedaler's Pub, there's something for every pizza lover in Bentonville. Don't miss Oven & Tap's amazing pizzas and delicious appetizers, or Tavola Trattoria's classic Margherita and unique U District and Tavola pies. And for a slice of New York-style pizza, be sure to check out Johnny Brusco's or Slice. Or grab a slice and a cold beer at Slice, located right next to Bentonville Dive. So come on down and enjoy some of the best pizza in Arkansas!

Bentonville

Oven & Tap

📍 215 S Main St #3

Photo courtesy of Oven & Tap

This is an NWA Daily top pick! The owners’ attention to detail in the atmosphere, menu, and ingredients are noticed throughout the dining experience. Starting with cocktails and appetizers is a must! (Hello, Pimento Cheese and Edamame!) Save room for their amazing pizzas (you can’t go wrong with the famous Sweet Joe)! This is the perfect spot for date night or an evening with friends.

Instagram, Facebook


Pedaler's Pub

📍 410 SW A St

Photo courtesy of NWA Daily

Fun, laid back atmosphere with a great patio… perfect stop on your bike ride! They offer thin crust, wood fire pizza and have a full list of yummy appetizers and drinks!

Instagram, Facebook


Priato Pizzeria

📍 211 NE A St

Photo courtesy of Hangry Peddler

This food truck is located in the heart of Downtown Bentonville. We highly recommend on a nice day. These artisan-crafted, Neapolitan-style pizza are made fresh and fast.

Facebook


Johnny Brusco’s New York Style Pizza

📍 ​​700 SE Walton Blvd #10

Photo courtesy of Johnny Brusco's

These New York style pizzas are great for dine in, carry out, or delivery. On Tuesdays, catch the $1 cheese slice after 4pm.

Facebook


Tavola Trattoria

📍 108 SE A St

Photo courtesy of Tavola Trattoria

Known for their amazing italian pastas, people usually pass over the pizza offering… don’t be a victim to this and try the Tavola and the U District Pizza. You also can’t go wrong with their classic Margherita. They are located in the heart of downtown Bentonville.

Instagram, Facebook


Slice

📍 115 NW 2nd St

Photo courtesy of NWA Daily

New kids on the block and definitely worth a visit. They offer New York style pizza with dough and sauce homemade daily from a family recipe. This food truck is located right next to Bentonville Dive so you can enjoy a slice of delicious pizza with a cold beer.

Instagram


Loafin Joe's

📍 801 SE 8th St

Photo courtesy of Loafin Joe's

A food truck at 8th Street Market near downtown Bentonville. See above description of Loafin Joe's in Fayetteville to see more details

Instagram, Facebook

Thanks for joining us on this delicious tour of the best pizza in Bentonville, Arkansas! From the artisan-crafted, Neapolitan-style pizzas at Priato Pizzeria to the wood-fired pies at Pedaler's Pub, there's something for every pizza lover in Bentonville. Don't miss Oven & Tap's amazing pizzas and delicious appetizers, or Tavola Trattoria's classic Margherita and unique U District and Tavola pies. And for a slice of New York-style pizza, be sure to check out Johnny Brusco's or Slice. Or grab a slice and a cold beer at Slice, located right next to Bentonville Dive. So next time you're craving a slice (or an entire pie) in Bentonville, be sure to check out one of these fantastic pizzerias. Thanks for reading, and happy eating!

node.description: Looking for delicious pizza in Bentonville, Arkansas? Look no further! From Priato Pizzeria's artisan-crafted, Neapolitan-style pizzas to Pedaler's Pub's wood-fired pies, we've got something for every pizza lover. Don't miss Oven & Tap's amazing pizzas and appetizers, or Tavola Trattoria's classic Margherita and unique U District and Tavola pies. For a slice of New York-style pizza, check out Johnny Brusco's or Slice. Or grab a slice and a cold beer at Slice, located right next to Bentonville Dive. Satisfy your pizza cravings at one of these fantastic pizzerias in Bentonville, Arkansas today!

node.content:
Ready to explore the beer scene in Rogers, Arkansas? Look no further! We've got a list of local breweries that will satisfy all your sudsy cravings. From German-style ales to hazy IPAs, these breweries have something for every taste. But don't just take our word for it - grab some friends and head on out to discover your new favorite brew. Cheers!

First up on our list is New Province Brewing Company, an independent, locally owned brewery that prides itself on quality. Plus, every Wednesday they host trivia night and local food trucks - talk about a perfect evening out! Next, we've got Natural State Beer Company, known for its "rigorous quality standards" and award-winning ales. With a convenient location off the Razorback Greenway, it's an easy stop for a refreshing drink.

If old-world beer styles with a modern twist are more your thing, check out Hawk Moth Brewery in historic downtown Rogers. And for a brewery that's all about "Hard Work" and "Honest Beer," head to Ozark Beer Company, a top 5 brewery in NWA according to Southern Living, Men's Journal, and Food & Wine. Finally, there's Rendezvous Junction Brewing Co., a neighborhood brewery that invites you to join their TasteBuds and keep the tastes as good as they can be.

Rogers

New Province Brewing Company

📍1310 W Hudson Rd

Photo courtesy of New Province Brewing Company

New Province is independent and locally owned, each ounce of beer made on-site in a brewery viewable by customers who come in and drink one or a few of the available beers. Every Wednesday from 7-9p New Province hosts a trivia night and local food trucks make an appearance and add to the evening!

Facebook - Twitter


Natural State Beer Company

📍5214 Village Pkwy

NWA Daily

Natural State Beer Company is known for its "rigorous quality standards" for its beer, and multiple awards attest to the deliciousness of its ales. NSBC is easily accessible off the Razorback Greenway and not far from Pinnacle Hills Promenade, making it a perfect location for a pitstop on any type of day. We recommend trying a flight of their German ales.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter


Hawk Moth Brewery 

📍710 N 2nd St

NWA Daily

Hawk Moth is a locally owned small-batch brewery and beer parlor located in historic downtown Rogers dedicated to enhancing your experience of beer. You'll find here old-world beer styles with a modern American twist. Hawk Moth focuses heavily on barrel aging and blending as well. Our beer of choice from Hawk Moth is their Hazy IPA.

Instagram- Facebook


Ozark Beer Company

📍109 N Arkansas St

NWA Daily

Ozark Beer Company is the home of "Hard Work" and "Honest Beer." This brewery offers a variety of year-round and seasonal beers aged in the Ozark Celler. Ozark Beer Co marks another central location, just across from the Railyard, Lake Atalanta, and a few miles from Beaver Lake. Recognized by Southern Living, Men's Journal, and Food & Wine, Ozark Beer Co is a top 5 brewery in NWA.

Instagram - Facebook


Rendezvous Junction Brewing Co. 

📍2225 S Bellview Rd

Photo courtesy of Rendezvous Junction Co.

Rendezvous Junction is just that -- a junction for people brought together by great beer. It is located across from the Pinnacle Hills Promenade "crafting beer that brings taste & buds together." RJBC started out as home brews being shared with friends and evolved into a neighborhood brewery that invites people to join the TasteBuds to keep the tastes as good as they can be.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter

So there you have it, a round-up of some of the best breweries in Rogers, Arkansas! Whether you're a fan of German ales, hazy IPAs, or small-batch brews, there's something for everyone on this list. And with several breweries located in the heart of downtown and within easy reach of popular attractions like Lake Atalanta and Pinnacle Hills Promenade, it's easy to make a day of it and visit a few different breweries in one outing. So next time you're in Rogers, be sure to check out one (or more!) of these local breweries and taste the best that the city has to offer. Cheers!
node.title: NWA Daily's Guide to Breweries in Rogers, AR
node.description: Looking for a delicious craft beer in Rogers, Arkansas? Look no further! We've compiled a list of the best breweries in the area, from New Province Brewing Company to Rendezvous Junction Brewing Co. You'll find everything from trivia nights to old-world beer styles with a modern twist. Come for the beer and stay for the community at these locally owned and operated breweries. Don't forget to try a flight and see which one is your favorite!

node.content:
Fall is on it’s way along with all the best traditions that come with it! We’ve made a guide of farms in NWA where you can go for pumpkin patches, corn mazes, hay rides, carnival games, and all those fun things! Enjoy, and happy fall!

McGarrah Farms Rivercrest Orchard

📍2991 Dead Horse Mountain Rd, Fayetteville

Photo courtesy of McGarrah Farms Rivercrest Orchard

The McGarrah Farms Rivercrest Orchard is the place to pick and play! Fall on the Farm is Sep 10-Oct 30, complete with a barnyard playground, face painting, bounce pillow, hayrides, food, train rides, apple picking, sunflowers, and more! It is open Thursdays-Sundays this fall. 

Facebook

McGarrah Farms 

📍14816 Miser Rd, Pea Ridge 

Photo courtesy of McGarrah Farms

McGarrah Farms in Pea Ridge is a family farm and a great place to enjoy nature, spend quality time with your family, and have lots of fun! The farm in Pea Ridge provides a place to pick your own pumpkins from the vine with a $12 admission fee. The patch is closed on Tuesdays and open until October 31. 

Facebook

Cobblestone Farms

📍1210 N 54th Ave, Fayetteville 

Photo courtesy of Cobblestone Farms

Cobblestone Farms has a mission to cultivate a community free from hunger through sustainable agriculture. The farm is 25 acres, and in the fall, they have pumpkins for picking! 

Facebook

Reagan Family Farm

📍241 E 13th St, Fayetteville

Photo courtesy of Reagan Family Farm

The Reagan Family Farm has all the pumpkins you need during pumpkin season, from stacking pumpkins to jack-o-lanterns and pie pumpkins. If you’re looking for gourds, you’ll find those here too. 

Facebook

Sequoyah UMC Youth Pumpkin Patch 

📍1910 Old Wire Road, Fayetteville

Photo courtesy of The Sequoyah UMC Youth Pumpkin Patch

The Sequoyah UMC Youth Pumpkin Patch is open the whole month of October with thousands of pumpkins to choose from. Pumpkins and gourds of all sizes are available to the public and are grown as a fundraiser for the Navajo Indian reservation in northwest New Mexico. 

Facebook

Farmland Adventures 

📍5355 Parsons Rd, Springdale

Photo courtesy of Farmland Adventures

Farmland Adventures is another place for outdoor family fun on the farm! There is a variety of attractions on the 9-acre farm, including a giant corn maze, a pumpkin patch, pony rides, farm animals, pig races, and a kids' play area. Groups can reserve fire pits, too! 

Facebook

Appel Farms 

📍5909 County Rd 56, Springdale

Photo courtesy of Appel Farms

Appel Farms is veteran-owned and operated and grows a variety of produce as well as free-range chicken eggs. Sweet corn is a great end-of-summer/beginning-of-fall vegetable, and there always seems to be plenty of it! As for pumpkins, you can pick your own from the patch or choose from a pile already picked.

Vanzant Fruit Farm

📍3705 E Hwy 264, Lowell 

Photo courtesy of Vanzant Fruit Farms

Vanzant Fruit Farm decorates the whole place for Halloween to get everyone in the seasonal spirit of fall. The atmosphere is inviting, and the pumpkins are ready for picking by the end of September. Vanzant's is open Monday-Saturday 8-6p.

Facebook

Blue Ribbon Farms

📍6069 AR-112 Springdale

Photo courtesy of Blue Ribbon Farms

Starting Sept 30 through Oct 30, Ozark Fall Fest at Blue Ribbon Farms will have hayrides, pig races, bonfires, food & beverages, music, and more! There have been corn cannons and pumpkin chunkers in the past...

Facebook

Ranalli Farms

📍1690 W Henri De Tonti Blvd, Springdale 

Photo courtesy of Ranalli Farms

Ranalli Farms has served the community for generations, and every year they have a plentiful pumpkin patch, and admission is free! While you’re there, you can check out their other produce and baked goods! 

Facebook


In the Pines Pumpkin Patch

📍1836 US-412, Hindsville

Photo courtesy of Pines Pumpkin Patch

In the Pines Pumpkin Patch has served the community since 1990 and have created an environment you want to experience. You can pick pumpkins in the midst of an enchanted forest and enjoy their seasonal gift shop with hand made crafts, locally made jams, and wooden game boards. They are open every day except Tuesday.

Facebook

Northwest Arkansas National Airport Flight Guide

XNA offers service from 6 airlines: 

- Allegiant Air

- American Airlines

- Breeze Airways

- Delta Air Lines

- Frontier Airlines

- United Airlines

Allegiant Air, Breeze Airways, and Frontier Airlines are all low-cost carriers and periodically bring fares for the other three airlines down, sometimes by creating competition. 

XNA has 22 nonstop fights: 

  1. Atlanta - Delta
  2. Austin (Currently suspended) - Allegiant
  3. Charlotte - American 
  4. Chicago - American, United 
  5. Dallas - American 
  6. Denver - Frontier, United
  7. Destin/Ft. Walton (seasonal) - Allegiant 
  8. Fort Lauderdale - Allegiant
  9. Houston - United
  10. Las Vegas (seasonal) - Allegiant, Frontier 
  11. Los Angeles - Allegiant, American
  12. Miami - American
  13. Minneapolis - Delta
  14. Nashville (seasonal) - Allegiant
  15. New Orleans - Breeze 
  16. New York City - American, Delta
  17. Orlando/Sanford (seasonal) - Allegiant 
  18. Phoenix/Mesa (seasonal) - Allegiant 
  19. Punta Gorda - Allegient 
  20. St Pete/Clearwater - Allegiant

Stay up to date

Airfares change with the economy, and schedules shift depending on the season. Fare Flight NWA is the region’s resource for the most insightful up-to-date information regarding all things traveling with XNA. 

If you’re trying to figure out if you should fly out of XNA or travel to the next closest airport, be sure to use Fare Flight’s Cost Calculator to see which option is most sustainable for you!

node.content:
5 of the Best Fall Hikes in NWA

The colors of the fall foliage, the brisk temperatures with warm sun, and the out-of-this-world sunsets. These are just a few of the reasons you should get outside this Fall to explore the beauty of the Ozarks. Whether you’re visiting Northwest Arkansas for the first time, or you’re a local that needs a new trail to explore, or you just want a reminder of where to enjoy the Fall season–we rounded up six of the the best Fall hikes to explore in NWA. The hikes range in difficulty and length, but all are guaranteed to provide a fun adventure with scenic views. Special thanks to our friends at 37 North Expeditions for putting this guide together!

Lost Valley

📍Trail Head: Lost Valley Rd, Kingston, AR 72742

Photo: Courtesy of Arkansas Tourism

This is one of the most gorgeous and popular hikes in all of the Ozarks. Lost Valley’s beauty shines year-round, but it’s extra special once Fall starts to show its colors. This trail is an easy going, 2.2 mile out and back hike. The main points of interest on the hike are Eden Falls and Cobb Cave. Eden falls cascades over 50 feet into Clark Creek!

  • Length: 2.2-Miles Out & Back
  • Difficulty: Easy-Moderate

Sam’s Throne

📍Trail Head: Sam's Throne Campground, Arkansas 72655

Photo: Courtesy of 37 North Expeditions

Sam’s Throne leads you down along a ridge before crossing a saddle with spectacular views on both sides (the perfect place to check out the changing fall colors). After about 1.5 miles, there is a short rock scramble to a hilltop. It’s worth it for the 360 degree views! 

  • Length: 2.9-Mile Loop
  • Difficulty: Moderate

Devil’s Den – Yellow Rock Trail

📍Trail Head 11333 West Arkansas Hwy. 74 West Fork, AR 72774

Photo: Courtesy Parker Dodson

The main feature of the Yellow Rock Trail is the Yellow Rock overlook which gives you a wide open view of Lee Creek Valley and fall foliage as far as the eye can see. This trail is considered moderate.

  • Length: 3-Mile Loop
  • Difficulty: Moderate

Alum Cove

📍Trail Head: Alum Cove Natural Bridge Recreation Area, Deer, AR 72628

Photo: Courtesy of 37 North Expeditions

The Alum Cove starts off by crossing over the top of a natural bridge and then allows you to see it from below. After you continue around the loop you follow a small creek and where you’ll see many small caves that you can pop in and out of. This hike is perfect for a quick getaway adventure!

  • Length: 1.2-Mile Loop
  • Difficulty: Moderate

Richland Creek - Twin Falls

📍Trail Head: Searcy 1 Hwy, Witts Springs, AR 72686

Photo: Courtesy Arkansas Tourism

Richland Creek Wilderness is most known by kayakers, but the hiking in this area is like nowhere else. Twin falls is a moderate to difficult hike where you have multiple water crossings. The trail leads you along the amazing river with large boulders all over then ends at Twin Falls where you can wade out to this stunning double waterfall.

  • Length: 5.1 Mile Out & Back
  • Difficulty: Moderate-Difficult


Fall trail suggestions and tips are provided by 37 North Expeditions who curates outdoor experiences that blend social interactions, physical activity, and outdoor education. You can check out their pre-scheduled trip offerings on their website or contact them to schedule a private outdoor experience.
node.title: 5 of the Best Fall Hikes in NWA
node.description: Best fall hikes in Northwest Arkansas. Fall is the best time to explore the Ozarks and all it wonderful trails, colors and views.

node.content:
Fayetteville

Mount Sequoyah

📍1680 E Paddock Rd

Photo courtesy of Johnathan Bitler - Facebook

The Mount Sequoyah woods is a 97-acre park featuring approximately 4.5 miles of multi-purpose, natural-surface trail that meanders through the forest on the east side of Mt. Sequoyah. The trailhead on East Paddock road leads to a picnic area and pavilion. This is a perfect place to slip into the wilderness so close to home. 

Facebook

Lake Sequoyah

📍6608 E Lake Sequoyah Dr

Photo courtesy of Lake Sequoyah Facebook

The Lake Sequoyah trails are in a nature area in southeast Fayetteville. There are three sections of trails that begin at the boat docks. The north trail, King Fisher Trail, is 3.8 miles down and back. The south trail, Rookery Trail, is 4 miles down and back. The third section of trail is a quarter mile one way on the west side of the lake. Nothing quite beats walking next to the water. 

Facebook

Lake Fayetteville 

📍1153 Lake Fayetteville Rd

Photo courtesy of the City of Fayetteville

Lake Fayetteville Park is one of our favorite places to roam. The park consists of 458 acres of land and 194 acres of water. There is a 5.5-mile nature trail around the lake and 4.3 miles of hard-surface trail that also circles the lake. The North Shore Park, Veterans Memorial Park, and The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks are all close, so your roaming can last all day.

Facebook

Kessler Mountain Regional Park

📍2600 W. Judge Cummings Rd

NWA Daily

The Kessler Mountain Regional Park totals around 620 acres on and around historic Kessler Mountain, which reaches 1,856 feet above sea level. The park includes a nearly 400-acre nature preserve and is a popular area for hiking and mountain biking with more than 10 miles of natural surface trail.

Facebook

Springdale 

Fitzgerald Mountain 

📍2300 Deer Valley St

Photo courtesy of Bradford Bowen - Facebook

Fitzgerald Mountain has a network that adds up to 11 miles, but with the punchy climbs and rocky descents, it feels like 20. If you’re going with your mountain bike, the stonemasonry of trails like Stage Coach, Coyote Cave, and the “affectionately named” Best Trail Ever is worth the trip. The mountain is nearby Bayyari Park and Runway Bike Park as well, so your trail ride or walking exploration never really has to end.

Facebook - OZ Trails

Rogers

Hobbs State Park-Conservation Area

📍20201 AR-12

NWA Daily

Hobbs State Park is the largest state park in Arkansas and is right here in Rogers on the southern shore of Beaver Lake. It spans over 12,000 acres and has over 54 miles of trail, with multiple camping sites. There are 8 total trails that are a part of the Conservation Area’s Monument Trails, accessible to mountain bikers, hikers, and trail runners.

Facebook

Lake Atalanta

📍500 E Walnut St

Photo courtesy of the City of Rogers

Lake Atalanta is a reservoir along Prairie Creek in Rogers with a 1.8-mile loop trail featuring a beautiful forest setting and is appropriate for all levels. The Lake Atalanta park is 236 acres with the trail system beginning down the hill from Historic Downtown Rogers on the south side of Walnut St.

Facebook

Bentonville

Crystal Bridges Trails & Grounds

📍600 Museum Way

Photo courtesy of Crystal Bridges

Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art sits on 120 acres of native Ozark forest that includes natural springs, streams, geographical features, native plants, and animals all accessible for us to enjoy via the trail system throughout. The trails include the Art Trail, Crystal Springs Trail, Crystal Bridges Trail, North Forest Trail, North Lawn Trail, Orchard Trail, Rock Ledge Trail, and the Tulip Tree Trail. 

Facebook

Coler Mountain 

📍11840-11850 Peach Orchard Rd

NWA Daily

The Coler Mountain Bike Preserve is most well known for its 17+ miles of mountain biking trails, but there are also trails for running or taking a stroll. At the heart of the preserve is The Homestead where the trails meet and an open-air barn and a coffee shop welcome those who have made the trek. 

Facebook

Bella Vista

Blowing Springs Park

📍700 Blowing Springs Rd

Photo courtesy of Susan Morris - Facebook

Blowing Springs is in the southern part of Bella Vista with a trail system that contains about 30 miles of trails and connects easily to Slaughter Pen, the Back 40 and Little Sugar, and downtown Bentonville. Blowing Springs has it all from waterfalls to caves and endless greenery.

Facebook

Tanyard Creek

📍Waterfall Trl

Photo courtesy of beautifulbellavista.com

The Tanyard Creek Trail is a beautiful trail off the beaten path in Bella Vista and an excellent way to see the natural world of Northwest Arkansas. It's a small 2.2-mile loop below the Windsor Lake Dam and has a wonderful waterfall, especially after it rains. You're sure see some wildlife as you walk through the forest and up the creek.

Facebook

A little further out

Devil’s Den State Park

📍Winslow

Photo courtesy of Jae's Photo Visuals - Facebook

Devils Den is another one of Arkansas’ state parks so close to home. It’s a 2,500-acre park with trails for day-hikers and mountain bikers alike. There are 11 wonderful trails for anyone to explore and experience breathtaking views and maybe even some fossils or evidence of early settlers on the Fossil Flats Trail.

Facebook

Buffalo National River

📍Arkansas

NWA Daily

The Buffalo National River park encompasses over 95,000 acres and is linked together by a growing network of hiking trails and campgrounds, with backcountry camping allowed on certain trails. There are the Upper, Middle, and Lower District hiking trails for you to choose from and endless sights to see.

Facebook

Ozark Highlands trail

📍Forest Service Rd

Photo courtesy of Ozark Highlands Trail Association

The Ozark Highlands Trail is recognized as one of the most scenic trails in the U.S. It’s a hiking trail that spans an impressive length of 218 miles through Northwest Arkansas. It starts at Lake Ft. Smith Park on Arkansas 71 and crosses the Ozark National Forest all the way to the Buffalo National River. Traveling through a variety of forest landscapes and elevations, access points to the trail are located along its entirety. 

Facebook

node.content:
Fayetteville

Wilson Park Pool 

📍675 N Park Ave

Photo courtesy of City of Fayetteville

The Wilson Park Pool is tucked into the beautiful landscaping of Wilson Park and is surrounded by shady trees, making it a wonderful place to swim. Open swim is 1-4:30p on weekdays and 1-6p on the weekends. Family Swim is 6-8p on MWF. Admission prices are $4 for adults, $3 for youth, and $8 per family for Family Swim. 

Walker Park  

📍1005 S Block Ave

Photo courtesy of City of Fayetteville

The Walker Park Splash Pad will be open daily 9-8p until the third Sunday in September. The water mechanisms are button operated and run for several minutes at a time. The splash park is but one of the amenities at Walker Park and is a great location for outdoor family gatherings. 

﻿Fayetteville Boys and Girls Club

📍560 N Rupple Rd

Photo courtesy of Fayetteville Boys & Girls Club

The Fayetteville Boys and Girls club is an indoor facility, open year-round, with a pool, perfect for swimming laps and Family Swim. Adult Lap Swim is 7:30-9:30a and 11:30-1p Monday-Friday, and Family Swim is 3:30-6p Monday-Friday and 10-1p Saturday. Memberships are required.

Facebook

Bentonville

Community Center 

📍1101 SW Citizens Dr

Photo courtesy of Rick Myers - Facebook

The Bentonville Community Center has an incredible indoor pool, splash pad, lazy river, etc. open year-round for the whole family to enjoy! They offer swim lessons, diving camps, and pool party reservations on request. Open swim is 12-7p on weekdays and 12-6p on weekends.

Facebook

Melvin Ford Aquatic Center 

📍200 N.E. Memorial Park Square

Photo courtesy of Melvin Ford Aquatic Center

​​The Melvin Ford Aquatic Center has something for people of all ages and swimming abilities! There is a 50-meter competition pool that ranges from 3-8 feet deep, a 13-foot deep diving well with two diving boards, and a one-foot deep wading pool for kids that features a rain drop fountain. Admission to the Aquatic Center is $3 for adults and $2 for those under 18. 

Facebook

Fountains at Lawrence Plaza 

📍214 NE A St

NWA Daily

The Fountains at Lawrence Plaza are a great way to cool off in the summer! It’s in a perfect location too, right off Bentonville Square and across from Compton Gardens. The splash park is open from 9a-10p every day until September 11.

Rogers

Rogers Aquatics Center 

📍707 S 26th St

Photo courtesy of Rogers Aquatic Center

The Rogers Aquatic Center is a beautiful three-acre waterpark filled with water fun for the whole family. Attractions at the Rogers Aquatic Center include the Cement Pond, Hawks Nest Falls, Otter Holler, Tod Pole Hole, White River Run, and much more. Daily admission varies for Rogers residents and non-residents and for children 4 feet tall and under. Season passes are available too!

Facebook

Rogers Skate & Splash Park

📍315 W Olive St

NWA Daily

The Rogers Skate & Splash Park has 10 in-ground sprinklers, two moveable water cannons, three water buckets, drinking fountains, and park benches all next to a playground and skate park. If the water at the splash park is not on, cover the black knob on the railroad crossing sign with your hands and the water will come on! The park is free to use and is open 6a-10p seven days a week.

Water Stop Splash Park

📍212 S 1st St 

NWA Daily

The Water Stop splash pad is part of Railyard Park in the heart of Downtown Rogers and includes a Play Yard, picnic tables, benches, and shade structures. The park also has the Butterfield Stage where free concerts take place and is by many shops and restaurants. It’s the perfect, central spot for an outing with the kids in Rogers.

Springdale

The Jones Center pool

📍922 E Emma Ave

Photo courtesy of The Jones Center

The Jones Center has an indoor leisure pool with a wrap-around slide and a Junior Olympic-size lap pool open to the public. Family Swim hours are Tuesday-Saturday 12-6p and Sunday 1:30-5p. Lap Swim is every day with varying hours. A Day Pass for non-members is $4 and Family Passes are $12 for families up to four, then $3 for additional members.

Facebook

Springdale Aquatic Center 

📍1100 Watson Dr

Photo courtesy of Vernon Tarver - Flickr

​​The Springdale Aquatic Center has two pools, a diving well, splash pad, water fountain, concessions, shaded seating areas, a pavilion for gatherings and parties, and more! Admission is $3 for children ages 0-3 and $4 for 5-year-olds and older. A Splash Pass is available for $80 which allows 25 visits.

C.L. “Charlie” and Willie George Park

📍4023 Hylton Rd

Photo courtesy of Springdale Parks and Recreation

Among its many features and amenities, the C.L. “Charlie” and Willie George Park has a Splash Pad open daily from 9a-9p and 11a-9p on Wednesdays. The splash pad is one of three in the city of Springdale which will remain open through mid-September.

Shaw Family Park 

📍7341 W Downum Rd

Photo courtesy of motherlode.com

Shaw Family Park is a 120-acre park open to the public with a splash pad perfect for cooling off after playing on the nearby trails or playgrounds. There’s something for the whole family with a fishing pond, a dog park, and areas for biking or picnicking! The splash pad is open daily 9a-9p and 11a-9p on Wednesdays.

Tyson Sports Complex

📍4300 Watkins Ave

NWA Daily

The Tyson Park includes Springdale’s third splash pad, also open daily 9a-9p and 11a-9p on Wednesdays throughout the summer!

Siloam Springs

Family Aquatic Center 

📍1800 N Mt Olive

Photo courtesy of the City of Siloam Springs

The Family Aquatic Center is open Memorial Day through Labor Day each year. The center has a beach entry main pool, diving board, and baby pool with fountain and water slides. Hours for the public are Monday/Wednesday/Friday 1-6p, Tuesday/Thursday/Saturday 1-9p, and Sunday 2-6p. Admission is $3 for ages 3 and under, and $5 for ages 4 and up.

node.content:
Northwest Arkansas is a fantastic destination for mountain bikers, with a variety of trails to suit riders of all skill levels. Here is a guide to some of the best mountain biking trails in the area:

  1. Lake Atalanta Trail in Rogers: This beautiful 6.5-mile trail offers a mix of singletrack and gravel paths, with a variety of terrain and scenic views. The trail is well-marked and relatively easy, making it a great option for beginners.
  2. Slaughter Pen Trail in Bentonville: This popular trail system features more than 10 miles of singletrack, with a mix of challenging climbs and fast descents. The trails are well-maintained and offer plenty of technical features, making them a great option for intermediate and advanced riders.
  3. Mount Kessler Trail in Fayetteville: This strenuous 7.5-mile trail features steep climbs, rocky descents, and plenty of technical challenges. The trail is best suited for advanced riders, but offers rewarding views and a sense of accomplishment for those who are up to the challenge.
  4. Lake Fayetteville Trail in Fayetteville: This easy 6-mile trail offers a mix of singletrack and gravel paths, with minimal elevation gain and a few technical features. The trail is great for beginners or riders looking for a leisurely ride.
  5. Coler Mountain Bike Preserve in Bentonville: This massive trail system features more than 30 miles of singletrack, with a mix of technical challenges and scenic views. The trails are well-marked and offer a variety of options for riders of all skill levels.

Whether you're a beginner looking to get started or an experienced rider looking for a challenging trail, you'll find plenty of great options in northwest Arkansas.
node.title: 5 Mountain Bike Spots to Hit in Northwest Arkansas
node.description: A quick guide to hitting some of the best mountain biking spots in Northwest Arkansas across Fayetteville, Bentonville, and Rogers. Northwest Arkansas has been coined the "Mountain Biking Capital of the World", and this list will help you explore it

node.content:
Welcome to Rogers, Arkansas, home to some of the best pizzerias in the state! Whether you're in the mood for a classic slice or something a little more unique, we've got you covered. From The Rail Rogers' special crust and unique pizza options to Old Chicago Pizza's happy hour and great atmosphere for groups, there's something for everyone. Bariola's Pizzeria offers a laid back atmosphere with sports and arcade games, as well as free ice cream with their classic pizza. And if you're looking for a gourmet option, Artisan Wood Fired Kitchen boasts Neapolitan-inspired dough cooked in wood-fired ovens imported from Italy and a delicious nutella calzone for dessert. Finally, don't forget to check out Gusano's on Trivia night for even more fun. No matter where you choose to dine, you're sure to find some of the best pizza in Rogers. Happy eating!

Rogers

The Rail Rogers

📍 218 S 1st St

Photo courtesy of NWA Daily

Located in Downtown Rogers you’ll find a cool environment in the perfect location! Their crust is special and they offer unique pizza options. It is the local favorite, and we see why! If you’re not up for pizza, the pork shanks and wings are a favorite here!

Facebook


Old Chicago Pizza

📍 1900 W Pleasant Grove Rd

Photo courtesy of Old Chicago Pizza

Although you may find Old Chicago in other states, this is the only Arkansas location. It is great for groups and has a Happy hour from 3-6pm.

Instagram, Facebook


Bariola’s Pizzeria

📍 1728 S 46th St #101

Photo courtesy of Bariola's Pizzeria

The laid back atmosphere is perfect for an evening of watching sports and using the arcade. Their classic pizza has crispy crust AND they offer free ice cream.

Instagram, Facebook


Artisan Wood Fired Kitchen

📍 2203 S Promenade Blvd

Photo courtesy of Artisan Wood Fired Kitchen

Take a break from shopping and have some pizza at the Promenade. Neapolitan inspired dough is made daily and cooked in wood fired ovens imported from Italy. And for dessert, you should try the nutella calzone!

Instagram, Facebook


Gusano’s

📍 2603 W Pleasant Grove Rd #112

Photo courtesy of Gusano's

See above to Gusano’s Fayetteville location. The only difference is Trivia night on Tuesday night!

Instagram, Facebook

Whether you're in the mood for a unique crust or a classic slice, there's something for everyone here. Don't forget to check out the other options like pork shanks and wings at The Rail Rogers, happy hour at Old Chicago Pizza, a laid back atmosphere with sports and arcade games at Bariola's Pizzeria, gourmet Neapolitan-inspired pizza at Artisan Wood Fired Kitchen, or trivia night at Gusano's. No matter where you choose to dine, you're sure to have a great time and enjoy some delicious pizza. We hope to see you soon at one of these amazing pizzerias in Rogers!
node.title: Guide to Pizza in Rogers, Arkansas
node.description: Looking for delicious pizza in Rogers, Arkansas? Look no further! Check out The Rail Rogers, Old Chicago Pizza, Bariola's Pizzeria, Artisan Wood Fired Kitchen, and Gusano's for some of the best pizza in town. From unique crusts and unique options to happy hour and laid back atmospheres, there's something for everyone. Don't forget to try the pork shanks and wings, free ice cream, gourmet Neapolitan-inspired dough, and delicious nutella calzone. Whether you're in the mood for a classic slice or something a little more unique, these pizzerias have got you covered. So come on down to Rogers and enjoy some of the best pizza around!

node.content:
Northwest Arkansas is full of wonderful parks. While we don't have the space to talk about them all, we wanted to highlight several in different towns across the region - each with its own unique offerings.

Bentonville

Orchards Park

📍1100 NE John Deshields Blvd

Photo courtesy of Bentonville Parks & Recreation

Orchards Park is right across from the main entrance of Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art and was designed as a premier passive park with walking paths, beautifully landscaped areas and a pavilion perfect for picnics, and a lovely pond with a fountain. There's a dog station too, so you can bring your pup along.

Facebook


Memorial Park

📍401 NE Martin Luther King Jr Parkway

Photo courtesy of Bentonville Parks & Recreation

Memorial Park is Bentonville's premier community park with 73 acres. It gets its name from the Benton County Memorial at the park honoring the fallen soldiers from the county and the Benton County historical settlement marker. Along with sports courts and fields, there is a walking trail around the perimeter, playground areas, a skateboard park, and a lighted, reservable pavilion.


Park Springs

📍300 NW 10th St

Photo courtesy of Bentonville Parks & Recreation

Park Springs is a wonderful place for larger events with the lighted pavilion, fireplace, and picnic tables, all adjacent to the playground. The park has been a beneficial part of the history of Bentonville since the 1890s, and there are trees from 1776 and before at the park, including a State Champion Tree.


Osage Park

📍700 SW 16th St

NWA Daily

Osage Park is a lovely getaway right in the middle of town! The wetlands boardwalk is a unique experience perfect for every season. Go watch birds, see beavers, take your dog to the dog park, and play pickleball on the pickleball courts! You can also fish at Lake Bentonville while watching planes take off from Thaden Field airport.

Facebook


Bella Vista Lake Park

📍Off of Hwy 71 B North

Photo courtesy of Bentonville Parks & Recreation

Bella Vista Lake Park is a 132-acre community park, home to a 1.8-mile perimeter fitness trail, a pavilion, picnic tables, and a playground. We love taking strolls around the lake, maybe stopping to sit on a bench along the way.


Fayetteville

Lake Fayetteville Park

📍1153 Lake Fayetteville Rd

Photo courtesy of the City of Fayetteville

Lake Fayetteville Park is one of our favorite places to roam. The park consists of 458 acres of land and 194 acres of water. There is a 5.5-mile nature trail around the lake and 4.3 miles of hard-surface trail that also circles the lake. There are multiple components to the park, including the North Shore Park and disk golf course, Veterans Memorial Park, a boat dock and marina with boat and bike rentals, and The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks.

Facebook


Kessler Mountain Regional Park

📍2600 W. Judge Cummings Rd

NWA Daily

The Kessler Mountain Regional Park totals around 620 acres on and around historic Kessler Mountain, which reaches 1,856 feet above sea level. The park serves as a regional sports park and includes a nearly 400-acre nature preserve. It's a popular area for hiking and mountain biking with more than 10 miles of natural surface trail.

Facebook


Wilson Park

📍675 N Park Ave

Photo courtesy of the City of Fayetteville

Wilson Park is Fayetteville's first and oldest park encompassing 22.75 acres in the center of the city. Take a swim in the Wilson Park Pool and a stroll in the gardens, near a spring-fed pond and the popular "Castle" you see above. The park has a gazebo, picnic areas, swings, sports courts including a sand volleyball court, and more!


Walker Park

📍10 W 15th St

NWA Daily

Walker Park was the second designated park in Fayetteville and has been developed to meet a variety of recreational needs of the community. The Frisco Trail passes through Walker Park and connects to the Razorback Greenway. In the park, there is a splash pad, skateboard park, racquetball/handball courts, and a sand volleyball court. There are three pavilions for gathering and a 1.2-mile paved walking path around the park's perimeter.


Gulley Park

📍1850 E Township St

NWA Daily

Gulley Park is 27 acres and includes features such as trees, open fields, Niokaska Creek, and a pond. There is a paved and lighted 1.5-mile trail that circles the park, and of course, the gazebo. Click here to see the Gulley Park Master Plan for improvements. One of the hidden gems of Northwest Arkansas is the park's concert series on Thursday nights in the summer.


Rogers

Hobbs State Park-Conservation Area

📍20201 E Hwy 12

NWA Daily

Hobbs is Arkansas' largest state park, and it's right here in our backyard!! It spans 12,054 acres of Ozark landscape along the southern shore of Beaver Lake. The park is for day use and includes a 54-mile trail system with hiking, ADA accessible, mountain biking, and horseback riding trails. There are 11 primitive campsites and six are accessible by mountain biking only.

Facebook


Lake Atalanta Park & Trails

📍500 E Walnut St.

Photo courtesy of the City of Rogers

Lake Atalanta Park is a 236-acre park that includes the Railyard Bike Park. There is a fishing lake, an off-road bike trail, a paved stone walkway, a pavilion, picnic areas, a unique playground, and much more. We love going here for a nature walk and it's perfect for an outing with the kids!

Facebook


Railyard Park

📍216 S 1st St

NWA Daily

The Railyard Park is such a fun spot in Downtown Rogers! Primarily a play place and splash pad for kids, it's right next to the Frisco Plaza which is lined with picnic tables, and the Butterfield Stage where Railyard Live takes place.


Springdale

Murphy Park

📍501 S Pleasant St

Photo courtesy of Springdale Parks & Recreation

Murphy Park is Springdale's oldest park, sold to the city in 1955. It is a 40-acre site that features a play structure, a 3-acre pond open for fishing, a sand volleyball court, two rentable pavilions, 39 individual picnic tables, a 0.75-mile paved trail, and more.

Facebook


J.B. Hunt Park

📍2003 Fleming Dr.

Photo courtesy of Springdale Parks & Recreation

The J.B. Hunt Park is on a 200-acre site and features Lake Springdale. There is an 18-hole disk golf course, softball fields, play structures with wood chip fall zones, separate swing sets, paved trails totaling 3 miles, a mountain bike trail, and a pump track.


Runway Bike Park

📍922 E Emma Ave

Photo courtesy of Runway Bike Park

The Runway Bike Park is a 2.75-acre "state-of-the-art" bike park perfect for outdoor bicycle skills training, and it's located at The Jones Center. On the site, there is a Bicycle Playground, a Skills Course, and a Pump Track, which is one of the largest asphalt tracks in North America.

Facebook


Shaw Family Park

📍7341 W Downum Rd

Photo courtesy of nwamotherlode.com

Shaw Family Park is a 120-acre park in Northwest Springdale. It features four tennis courts, a splash pad, an extreme fitness area, two playgrounds, a dog park, five ponds (one stocked for fishing), three trails for walking or biking, two pavilions, and a natural use area.


Luther George Park

📍300 Park St

Photo courtesy of Billie Cucul - Facebook

Luther George Park is a 10-acre site with a 1/4 mile paved walking path, a pavilion with picnic tables, 21 individual picnic tables, a skate park, and 8 individual play structures with wood chip landing zones. As part of Springdale's downtown master plan and the Walton Family Foundation's Design Excellence Program, Luther Park is preparing to undergo an expansion and renovation. Learn more here.

Facebook
node.title: NWA Daily's Park Guide
node.description: Parks for kids in Northwest Arkansas including parks in Fayetteville, Springdale, Rogers, Bentonville

node.content:
If you don't already know about the extent of Northwest Arkansas' beer scene, live in the dark no longer because we have created a list of local breweries for your education and pleasure. Take part in the "Arkansas original craft beer tour" on the famed Ale Trail which covers ground all the way to Eureka Springs, or pick a new spot from below and invite your friends. Whatever may be your vibe we're just glad you're drinking local - cheers!

Rogers

New Province Brewing Company

📍1310 W Hudson Rd

Photo courtesy of New Province Brewing Company

New Province is independent and locally owned, each ounce of beer made on-site in a brewery viewable by customers who come in and drink one or a few of the available beers. Every Wednesday from 7-9p New Province hosts a trivia night and local food trucks make an appearance and add to the evening!

Facebook - Twitter


Natural State Beer Company

📍5214 Village Pkwy

NWA Daily

Natural State Beer Company is known for its "rigorous quality standards" for its beer, and multiple awards attest to the deliciousness of its ales. NSBC is easily accessible off the Razorback Greenway and not far from Pinnacle Hills Promenade, making it a perfect location for a pitstop on any type of day. We recommend trying a flight of their German ales.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter


Hawk Moth Brewery 

📍710 N 2nd St

NWA Daily

Hawk Moth is a locally owned small-batch brewery and beer parlor located in historic downtown Rogers dedicated to enhancing your experience of beer. You'll find here old-world beer styles with a modern American twist. Hawk Moth focuses heavily on barrel aging and blending as well. Our beer of choice from Hawk Moth is their Hazy IPA.

Instagram- Facebook


Ozark Beer Company

📍109 N Arkansas St

NWA Daily

Ozark Beer Company is the home of "Hard Work" and "Honest Beer." This brewery offers a variety of year-round and seasonal beers aged in the Ozark Celler. Ozark Beer Co marks another central location, just across from the Railyard, Lake Atalanta, and a few miles from Beaver Lake. Recognized by Southern Living, Men's Journal, and Food & Wine, Ozark Beer Co is a top 5 brewery in NWA.

Instagram - Facebook


Rendezvous Junction Brewing Co. 

📍2225 S Bellview Rd

Photo courtesy of Rendezvous Junction Co.

Rendezvous Junction is just that -- a junction for people brought together by great beer. It is located across from the Pinnacle Hills Promenade "crafting beer that brings taste & buds together." RJBC started out as home brews being shared with friends and evolved into a neighborhood brewery that invites people to join the TasteBuds to keep the tastes as good as they can be.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter

Bentonville

Bentonville Brewing Company

📍901 SW 14th St

NWA Daily

Bentonville Brewing is right off 14th St. in Bentonville next to Climb Bentonville. You'll find food trucks parked in the lot outside offering great grub before or after you sit down for some authentic and unique beers. Take a tour of the brewery before you try what's on tap for the whole experience. The beer is great here, but what might be better is the family environment. With an outdoor play area for kids and large beer garden, it is great for the family.

Instagram - Facebook


Bike Rack Brewing Co. 

📍801 SE 8th St

📍410 SW A St

NWA Daily

Bike Rack Brewing is Bentonville’s oldest brewery, continually crafting new ales using local inspiration and quality ingredients. If you like dark beer we recommend give the Coler Coffee Stout a try! It is a winter seasonal with espresso, crafted in collaboration with Airship Coffee. Known for its overlap with biking, you'll find beers here named Slaughter Pen, Urban Trail, and the Derailleur.

Instagram - Facebook


Bentonville Taproom

📍109 S Main St

Photo courtesy Bentonville Taproom

The Taproom in Bentonville is a state-of-the-art, family-friendly facility with play areas inside and outside as well as a dog park on-site for your four-legged furry friends. Music and events are regular affairs at The Taproom which include trivia, Euchre night, cornhole tournaments, and more. Grab food from food trucks nearby or order some German-style pub food from the kitchen inside.

Facebook


Ozark Beer at Rope Hounds

📍407 SW A St

NWA Daily

Ozark Beer at Rope Hounds is an iconic Dog-friendly taproom in downtown Bentonville right next to The Fire Truck Food Truck. The taproom features year-round, Small Batch and Pilot Batches of Ozark Beer Company’s taproom only draught. Cocktails, wine, and ciders are also on the table.

Instagram - Facebook


Social Project Brewing Co. 

📍600 SW 41st St

NWA Daily

Social Project Brewing Co. was founded on love for craft beer as well as community. If you like hop-heavy brews, you'll enjoy what Social Project has to offer. Go with friends or with the intention of meeting new ones, because in tandem with sensational beers, growing social circles is what this place is all about. They have an active rotation of beers, always trying variations. In our opinion, this might be one of the most overlooked and underrated breweries in NWA.

Instagram - Facebook

Fayetteville

Fossil Cove Brewing Co.

📍1946 N Birch Ave

Photo courtesy of Fossil Cove

The people behind Fossil Cove Brewing Co. love NWA and this little corner of the world, naming their brewery after a fossil-laden cove on the shores of Beaver Lake (the brewery's water source). They have a solid selection of 8-10 beers annually with seasonal rotations. If you're feeling like some grub, we definitely recommend a pizza from the food truck Wicked Wood Fired Pizza on site. Our beer of choice is the T-Rex or Birch Ave Blond.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter


West Mountain Brewing Co.

📍21 W Mountain St

Photo courtesy of West Mountain Brewing Co

West Mountain Brewing Co. is right next door to Tiny Tim's Pizza on the Historic Downtown Square of Fayetteville. This brewery is Northwest Arkansas' oldest brewery and has become a Fayetteville tradition with a wide selection of top-notch beers.

Facebook


Boston Mountain Brewing

📍121 W Township St

Photo courtesy of Boston Mountain Brewing

Boston Mountain Brewing offers a small in-house menu and additional offerings on the weekend. Enjoy the ever-changing array of beers throughout the week, and go on a Friday for some 99 cent wings. Hang out on the patio, and/or call ahead for a tour of the full space!

Facebook


Apple Blossom Brewing Company 

📍1550 E Zion Rd

Photo courtesy of Apple Blossom Brewing

Apple Blossom Brewing Company, named after the state flower, is the largest of its kind in the state of Arkansas with 8,500 SF of space and over 250 seats. There's a large patio, full bar, and great food so there's room for whatever time you're looking to have. It's also along the Greenway and walking distance from Lake Fayetteville trail making it a convenient location.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter


Crisis Brewing

📍210 South Archibald Yell Blvd

Photo courtesy of Crisis Brewing

Crisis Brewing is one of the more unique breweries in the area, nestled in a patch of trees almost hiding it from view in the summer months. It was named "lovingly after a midlife crisis" and created for the love of the craft of brewing and community. Crisis is the type of place only locals know about and serves up some of the best beer in the state. Hot take, this is the best beer in NWA.

Instagram- Facebook


Columbus House Brewery and Tap Room

📍701 W North St

Photo courtesy of Columbus Hous Brewery and Tap Room

Also right off the bike trail, Columbus House Brewery and Tap Room is an intimate, 3 barrel space with rotating and permanent taps run by NWA natives and University of Arkansas alum. The space is friendly and right next to Fayetteville Funky Flea Market. Columbus is perfect stop along the Ale Trail and encourages cyclist and runners to stop by at their leisure.

Instagram - Facebook

Springdale

Core Brewing & Distilling Co. 

📍N, 2470 Lowell Rd

Photo courtesy of Core Brewing & Distilling Co.

Core Brewing & Distilling prides itself in crafting beer with the diligence and pride of small-town America. If you're looking for somewhere that embodies southern vibes and hospitality, this is your place. Core is the official craft brewery of the Razorbacks and has their own beer to show for it. All in all their beer is solid, but what they might most be known and loved for is their Scarlet Letters.

Instagram


Saddlebock Brewery & Restaurant 

📍18244 Habberton Rd

Photo courtesy Saddlebock Brewery & Restaurant

On the shores of the White River, Saddlebock Brewery built a state-of-the-art and environmentally conscious brewery on a farm in Springdale. It is the first production brewery in Northwest Arkansas and is committed to brewing fine, European-style beers brewed in small batches without artificial ingredients or preservatives. These folks know how to handle the brewing process with care, and it's such a uniquely Arkansan location, you ought to give it a try.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter
