Welcome to the wonderful world of breweries in Bentonville, Arkansas! If you're a fan of craft beer, you'll definitely want to check out these local favorites. From the family-friendly atmosphere at Bentonville Brewing Company and the Taproom, to the hop-heavy brews at Social Project Brewing Co., there's something for every beer lover to enjoy in Bentonville. And if you're looking for a unique experience, don't miss the opportunity to try the small batch and pilot batches of Ozark Beer at Rope Hounds or the delicious German-style pub food at the Taproom. So grab some friends, or make some new ones, and cheers to a great selection of local breweries in Bentonville.

Bentonville

Bentonville Brewing Company

📍901 SW 14th St

NWA Daily

Bentonville Brewing is right off 14th St. in Bentonville next to Climb Bentonville. You'll find food trucks parked in the lot outside offering great grub before or after you sit down for some authentic and unique beers. Take a tour of the brewery before you try what's on tap for the whole experience. The beer is great here, but what might be better is the family environment. With an outdoor play area for kids and large beer garden, it is great for the family.

Instagram - Facebook


Bike Rack Brewing Co. 

📍801 SE 8th St

📍410 SW A St

NWA Daily

Bike Rack Brewing is Bentonville’s oldest brewery, continually crafting new ales using local inspiration and quality ingredients. If you like dark beer we recommend give the Coler Coffee Stout a try! It is a winter seasonal with espresso, crafted in collaboration with Airship Coffee. Known for its overlap with biking, you'll find beers here named Slaughter Pen, Urban Trail, and the Derailleur.

Instagram - Facebook


Bentonville Taproom

📍109 S Main St

Photo courtesy Bentonville Taproom

The Taproom in Bentonville is a state-of-the-art, family-friendly facility with play areas inside and outside as well as a dog park on-site for your four-legged furry friends. Music and events are regular affairs at The Taproom which include trivia, Euchre night, cornhole tournaments, and more. Grab food from food trucks nearby or order some German-style pub food from the kitchen inside.

Facebook


Ozark Beer at Rope Hounds

📍407 SW A St

NWA Daily

Ozark Beer at Rope Hounds is an iconic Dog-friendly taproom in downtown Bentonville right next to The Fire Truck Food Truck. The taproom features year-round, Small Batch and Pilot Batches of Ozark Beer Company’s taproom only draught. Cocktails, wine, and ciders are also on the table.

Instagram - Facebook


Social Project Brewing Co. 

📍600 SW 41st St

NWA Daily

Social Project Brewing Co. was founded on love for craft beer as well as community. If you like hop-heavy brews, you'll enjoy what Social Project has to offer. Go with friends or with the intention of meeting new ones, because in tandem with sensational beers, growing social circles is what this place is all about. They have an active rotation of beers, always trying variations. In our opinion, this might be one of the most overlooked and underrated breweries in NWA.

Instagram - Facebook

Bentonville, Arkansas is home to a variety of breweries that offer unique beers, great food, and a welcoming atmosphere for locals and visitors alike. From family-friendly options like Bentonville Brewing Company and Bentonville Taproom, to dog-friendly spots like Ozark Beer at Rope Hounds, there's something for everyone in this town. Whether you're a fan of hop-heavy brews or prefer something a little more dark and mysterious, you're sure to find something you'll love at one of these Bentonville breweries. So next time you're in town, be sure to check out one (or all!) of these amazing breweries and raise a glass to the great beer scene in Bentonville!
node.title: NWA Daily's Guide to Breweries in Bentonville, AR
node.description: Looking for a delicious and refreshing beer in Bentonville, Arkansas? Look no further! This article features a list of local breweries in Bentonville that are sure to satisfy your craft beer cravings. From the family-friendly Bentonville Brewing Company and its authentic and unique beers, to the hop-heavy brews at Social Project Brewing Co., there's something for every beer lover in this list. Don't forget to check out Bike Rack Brewing Co.'s Coler Coffee Stout and Ozark Beer at Rope Hounds for some truly standout options. Whether you're a local or just passing through, these breweries are a must-visit for anyone looking to experience the best of Bentonville's beer scene.

node.content:
There are so many options to choose from when it comes to Mexican food in NWA. We've compiled a list of our favorite spots for local, authentic Mexican restaurants that can only be found in NWA!

Fayetteville 

Mexico Viejo

📍2131 M.L.K. Jr Blvd

Photo courtesy of Mexico Viejo

Mexica Viejo Mexican Restaurant is on Martin Luther King Blvd and is open every day from 11a-10p. The dining area is large and portions are generous - perfect for gatherings and parties. There is a full bar with craft cocktails, and of course, delicious margaritas! 

Facebook

Mr. Taco Loco

📍1701 S School Ave

📍2227 W M.L.K. Jr Blvd

📍130 Emma Ave

Photo courtesy Mr. Taco Loco

Mr. Taco Loco is a classic NWA spot, and one of our very favorite taco joints. If you're looking for a spot to grab some street tacos and low priced drinks, Mr. Taco Loco has one of the best Taco Tuesday deals in the area. 

Facebook - Instagram

El Matador

📍3412 West Black Forrest Dr.

📍2998 US-412

Photo courtesy of Matador

El Matador Mexican Bar and Grill is another favorite, serving fresh, authentic cuisine in both Fayetteville and Siloam Springs. Matador is popular for both lunch and dinner and serves a large selection of meat, vegetarian, and seafood dishes. Definitely give the house Wedington Special a try! 

Facebook

Tula

📍1 E Center St

Photo courtesy of Tula

Tula is an authentic, upscale Mexican restaurant located right off of the square. It has great vibes, great drinks, and a wide variety of authentic dishes like queso fundido. Its convenient location puts it in walking distance of several fun after dinner drink options.

Facebook - Instagram

Mango’s 

📍2050 M.L.K. Jr Blvd

📍1940 N Crossover Rd

Photo courtesy of Mango's

With two locations in Fayetteville and a drive through, Mango's is a great option to pick up some delicious street tacos on the go. While tacos are an obvious choice at Mango's, it also has some other great options like stuffed jalapeños.

Facebook - Instagram - Twitter

Sabor Guacamole 

📍1120 N Lindell Avenue

Photo courtesy of Sabor Guacamole

Sabor Guacamole is go to spot near campus in Fayetteville with affordable dishes and some fantastic queso. Grab $1 tacos on Tuesdays or $2.99 margaritas on the rocks on Thursdays.

Facebook

Los Bobos

📍404 W Dickson St

Photo courtesy of Los Bobos

Open from 4p-3a Thursday-Saturday and right on Dickson, Los Bobos Taqueria serves street tacos and other Mexican fare for those out late. We recommend the tortas if you want to branch away from tacos for an evening.

Facebook

Con Quesos Tacos

📍2016 W M.L.K. Blvd

📍101 W Johnson Ave

Photo courtesy of Con Quesos

Con Quesos specializes in fusion tacos and specialty cheese dips. There are also traditional offerings such as the Los Cabos and Condesa, which hit the spot every time.

Facebook - Instagram

Springdale

La Media Luna

📍2135 Main Dr (Fayetteville)

NWA Daily

La Media Luna is tucked away in Johnson adding a unique, gourmet flair to its traditional Mexican dishes. Crowd favorites are the Cochinita Pibil and the Chile En Nogada, and they are a must. The restaurant hosts a Mariachi band on Friday nights and Jazz music on Thursday and Saturday nights, plus a patio when the weather is nice! The best part: they have happy hour deals from 4-6p on weeknights!

Facebook - Instagram

Taquerias Guanajuato

📍103 N Thompson St

📍812 N Thompson St

Photo courtesy of Taqueria Guanajuato

At Taqueria Guanajuato, they believe meals can be a culinary experience, and great food is only the beginning. Both locations in Springdale are upbeat and exciting atmospheres ready with an extensive delicious menu. 

Facebook

Taqueria Mexico

📍1205 S Thompson St

Photo courtesy of Taqueria Mexico

We know we are giving you too many tasty options to choose from in this guide, but Taqueria Mexico is another *chef's kiss* gem, and it's open until 10:30 every day of the week except Friday and Saturday when it is closed at 1p.

Mana Cabana Taqueria

📍992 E Henri De Tonti Blvd

Photo courtesy of Mana Cabana Taqueria

Mana Cabana Taqueria is another family-owned Mexican restaurant and has one of the more impressive menus with a Traditional Menu section, Sea Food, Healthy Food, Special of the Day, Kids Menu, and more. If you want something simple and delicious, try the champurrado and tamales!

Facebook - Instagram

Taqueria Don Guero

📍332 E Emma Ave

NWA Daily

Taqueria Don Guero is one of the best stops on Springdale’s authentic Taqueria tour. With the building’s bright, fun colors and the patio outside, it is such an exciting and pleasant place to get some street tacos while strolling through downtown. 

El Mazatleco

📍4111 S Thompson St

Photo courtesy of El Mazatleco

El Mazatleco Bar and Mexican Grill is another family-owned and operated Mexican restaurant in Springdale. The family is from the Mexican state of Sinaloa where they had a dream of opening a restaurant that offered a wide variety of Sinaloense food and homemade seafood with unique flavors relished in Mazatlan Sinaloa, the Pearl of the Pacific. And as they’ll tell you, the family’s dream came true, and now we have a piece of Mazatlan Sinaloa in Arkansas. 

Facebook - Instagram

Acapulco

📍1602 E Robinson Ave

Photo courtesy of Acapulco

At Acapulco, the chefs use vegetables that are hand-selected and meat that is fresh, it’s never frozen. The vegetarian tacos are impeccable for those who don’t eat meat. Go on a Tuesday for the $1.50 tacos and the $2 margaritas! 

Facebook

Bentonville

Rolling Taco

📍410 SW 8th St

NWA Daily

Rolling Taco is one of our favorite taco trucks in NWA and is in a great location on 8th street, just a bike ride away from the downtown square. The menu has all of your classic Mexican street meals. The restaurant's namesake, the Rolling Tacos, is 3 tacos, double tortilla with guacamole, cheese, sour cream, and salsa. 

Facebook - Instagram

Azul Tequila

📍1000 SE Walton Blvd

📍960 N 45th St (Springdale)

Bentonville square coming soon!

Photo courtesy Azul Tequila

Azul Tequila is an experience from the moment you walk in the door. Every corner of the restaurant is intentionally designed to portray Mexican family culture and coziness. Each cocktail and dish on the menu is a tribute to the owner’s family members and each ingredient is a representation of who they are, who they have been, and who they will be. In Azul Tequila you’re sure to feel warm and like a part of the family. 

Facebook

Maria's

📍2503 S Walton Blvd

📍2813 W Walnut St (Rogers)

Photo courtesy of Maria's

The first Maria’s Mexican Restaurant opened in Bentonville in 1999 and seated 25 people. Now, the same location seats 150 people and there are two more locations, one of which is in Rogers, the other in Fort Smith. Each location is cozy, has friendly staff, and of course, the food is always just what we’re looking for. 

Facebook

Yeyo's El Alma de Mexico

📍801 SE 8th St

NWA Daily

All Yeyo's produce is grown and its animals are raised on farms just outside Bentonville so as to “preserve and share our deepest roots and traditions, create a spiritual connection with artisanal Mezcal, art, food, and people.” Yeyo’s Mezcaleria & Taqueria, Yeyo's El Alma de Mexico, and the two food trucks weave food and art together into a cohesive and immersive experience and are the first of their kind in Arkansas. 

Facebook - Instagram

El Pueblito

📍300 E Centerton Blvd

Photo courtesy of El Pueblito

﻿El Pueblito is a hidden gem in Centerton. The dishes are fresh and authentic. We love the chips and salsa that come with the meal, and our go-to’s are the Chimichanga and the Fajita Taco Salad. 

Rogers

Yeyo's Mezcaleria y Taqueria

📍101 E Walnut St

NWA Daily

Yeyo's is all about bringing substance and meaning to its dishes. Like in Bentonville, you'll find fresh and purposeful foods here while surrounded by culture and family history.

Facebook - Instagram

Las Palmas

📍200 W Poplar St

📍301 N Walton Blvd (Bentonville)

📍1115 E Henri De Tonti Blvd (Springdale)

📍1084 W Sunset Ave (Springdale)

Photo courtesy of Las Palmas

Las Palmas’ motto is to spread happiness through food, and they do a good job of it! The first Las Palmas in NWA opened in downtown Rogers in 1994. This is our favorite location as it is close to the attractions of downtown, has great character, a large dining area, a full bar with TVs, and outside seating. 

Facebook

Yulianita's

📍2515 N 17th St

Photo courtesy of Yulianita's

The masterminds behind Yulianita’s make everything from scratch, which makes for a unique and authentic experience. The restaurant has all your traditional dishes and it is right off SE 14th St, or W Hudson Rd in Rogers, so you can pull off for a quick, convenient bite before continuing on your way. 

Taqueria Real Jacona

📍1713 S 8th St

📍2308 SE 28th St (Bentonville)

Photo courtesy of Taqueria Real Jacona

We love Taqueria Real Jacona in Rogers for its simple atmosphere and menu that hits the spot when you are just looking for some good old Mexican cuisine. If you like spicy salsa, they have a concoction you’re sure to love. Wash the spicy salsa down with a Mexican soda when you go for the full experience!

node.content:
Here's to all the breakfast and brunch lovers out there. We've compiled a list of our favorite places for morning dining here in NWA. Go explore and start your days by eating some great food!


Springdale

Buttered Biscuit

📍1403 SE Moberly Ln

📍1001 SW Regional Airport Blvd

📍1210 J.T.L Pkwy

📍1754 N. College Ave

Photo Courtesy of Buttered Biscuit

The Buttered Biscuit is quickly becoming an NWA favorite with 4 locations; 2 in Bentonville, 1 in Fayetteville, 1 in Springdale. At The Buttered Biscuit, you will always get an honest breakfast with quality ingredients. There’s a menu compatible for those with dietary restrictions as well, so the whole community can taste The Buttered Biscuit's unique flavors. 

Facebook - Twitter


Susan’s

📍1440 W Sunset Ave

Photo Courtesy of Susan's

Susan’s is known for being “World Famous Here Locally.” The restaurant is over 25 years old and has been serving great home-style meals since day 1. Breakfast is served from 6a-2p seven days a week. You’re sure to feel welcomed and part of the family at Susan’s.  

Instagram - Facebook  


Bites & Bowls

📍1602 E Robinson Ave

Photo Courtesy of Bites and Bowls

Bites & Bowls is a small, family-owned eatery that provides energizing meals. The breakfast and brunch menus feature yogurt bowls, smoothie bowls, oatmeal, an array of practically gourmet waffle options, and more. If you’re looking for something more hearty, give the “Wake Up!” a try. It’s a waffle made of hash browns, eggs, and more delicious ingredients. 

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter 


Big Sexy Food (Sundays)

📍107 E Emma Ave

Photo Courtesy of Big Sexy Food

The philosophy here is life is too short for ugly food, so make it sexy. Big Sexy Food located on Emma in downtown Springdale offers Sunday Brunch from 10-3p. You’ll want to try the BOB’s (Big ‘ol Biscuits) for just $3. But you can’t go wrong with a menu that has 3-egg omelets and breakfast burgers on it. 

Instagram - Facebook


 Hail Fellow Well Met

📍 5519 W. Hackett Rd

Photo Courtesy of Hail Fellow Well Met

Hail Fellow Well Met is Onyx’s first cafe location offering specialty food in a neighborhood cafe style. For breakfast or brunch, you can enjoy an array of baked items, egg and avocado toast offerings, yogurt meals, and more. Plus, you’ll walk into the cafe on Johnson’s up-and-coming main strip and feel like you’re in the movies. Go check it out. 

Instagram - Facebook


Fayetteville

 Little Bread Company

📍116 N Block Ave

Photo Courtesy of Little Bread Company

The Little Bread Company is a Fayetteville staple where a sizable variety of items are made from scratch every day. The staff strives to build community with their customers by calling them by name. The breakfast menu consists of 8 breakfast sandwiches all served with breakfast potatoes. The chocolate croissant is a MUST! After breakfast take a walk to the Fayetteville Square.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter


Stone Mill Bread Co. 

📍2600 N Gregg Ave.

📍4101 W Sunset Ave

📍2903 S. Walton Blvd

Photo Courtesy of Stone Mill Bread Co.

The people behind Stone Mill Bread Co. have combined what they think are the best ingredients for Stone Mill’s special flavored breads used in almost all the menu items. Have a breakfast sandwich, french toast, kolaches, biscuits, scones, and more for your flavorful first meal of the day. The Stone Mill team will also make bread with your choice of ingredient combinations! Cant make it to the OG Fayetteville location? There are locations in Bentonville and Springdale as well.

Instagram - Facebook


 Southern Food Co

📍3575 W Weddington Dr

Photo courtesy of Southern Food Co.

Southern Food Co. has breakfast Tues-Sun and Brunch on the weekends. The flavors here are all a delight and are dubbed as being Nouveau Southern Cuisine. The dishes come from a mix of regional southern home-style experiences and are dashed with a cajun flare with healthy alternatives to bring out the utmost flavorful experience. We recommend the Pork Huevos Rancheros if you make it out on a weekend. 

Instagram - Facebook

 

Prelude Breakfast Bar

📍509 W Spring St.

Photo Courtesy of Prelude

Just off Dickson Street, Prelude Breakfast Bar has earned its spot as a staple for the patrons of downtown Fayetteville. Ranging from a variety of scrumptious pancakes to a flavorful and filling meal, Prelude’s menu offers plenty of alluring options to keep their customers coming back to try the next item on the menu, no matter what their preferences.

Facebook 


Ella's Table

📍465 Arkansas Ave, Fayetteville, AR 72701

Photo Courtesy of NWA Daily

Ella's Table at Carnall Hall, located on the U of A campus near Dickson and the Fayetteville Square, is a great spot for a weekend brunch. With a new menu and a talented chef hailing from Southern California, they offer modern American favorites with a creative twist. Their brunch menu includes a variety of breakfast and lunch options, such as the chicken sandwich, the highly recommended eggs benedict, and options on the sweet side such as Pancakes and French Toast

Facebook - Instagram


East Side Grill (Weekend)

📍1838 N Crossover Rd

Photo Courtesy of East Side Grill

East Side Grill is one of the best-rated locations for brunch in Fayetteville with its bar offering killer cocktails for the morning side of the day. There is a “build-your-own” Bloody Mary on the menu as well as other brunch booze concoctions. We highly recommend getting the Country Fries for the table as they come fully loaded with crispy bacon, cheese, country gravy, & a fried egg. 

Instagram - Facebook


Rolling Pin Cafe

📍2565 E Huntsville Rd.

Photo Courtesy of Rolling Pin Cafe

Open from 6a-2p Tues-Sun, the Rolling Pin Cafe is perfect for all you early birds and late risers out there who want a classic breakfast or brunch made from scratch. The environment is homey and is a great spot for a big group meeting for a morning meal. With our mouths watering, we recommend the cinnamon rolls. 

Facebook


Arsaga’s Mill District

📍481 S School Ave.

Photo Courtesy of Arsaga's

Approaching each customer with love and care, Arsaga’s has been offering heartwarming service to the city of Fayetteville for 30 years. Arsaga’s Mill District location provides a brunch experience with obvious attention to detail, from the craft of their coffee to the ingredients in each menu item and even the visual design of the restaurant itself. Customers are invited to drink it all in and cherish every little thing. This is one of our go-to locations in NWA.

Instagram - Facebook 


Farmer's Table

📍1079 S School Ave

Photo Courtesy of Farmer's Table

Located in south Fayetteville in an old home, Farmer's Table has a mindfulness and a passion for sustaining the community are easy to see in what’s on the menu. This award-winning brunch spot sources all of its products locally and operates as a zero waste kitchen with organic ingredients and no GMOs. Though every item on the menu is uniquely tempting, we highly recommend trying their incredible sweet potato pancakes.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter


 Margaret Juan Rose

📍704 S Washington Ave

Photo Courtesy of Margaret Juan Rose

Locally sourced, reasonably priced, easy to learn menu, on wheels? Yep! Margaret Juan Rose offers all their standard meals for $9.50 (plus tax) with add-ons you can choose to spice up your brunch! This is a great place to bring all your furry friends! Keep an eye out for Margaret Juan Rose at your next local festival.

Instagram - Facebook


 Rick’s Iron Skillet

📍1131 S School Ave.

Photo Courtesy of Rick's Iron Skillet

Rick's Iron Skillet has been a breakfast and brunch staple of the NWA community for over 25 years with a very local customer base. Ricks will gladly serve you breakfast any time of day because let’s face it, breakfast is too good to happen only once a day! Try their classic omelet options next time you’re there! Come with an empty stomach and enjoy the southern style, home cooked meal.

Facebook


 Emelia's Kitchen (Weekend)

📍309 W Dickson St

Photo Courtesy of Emelia's Kitchen

Emelia’s Kitchen is a quaint Mediterranean kitchen and bar located on Dickson Street, easily accessible while on a Saturday or Sunday morning stroll. This might be the most overlooked and underrated breakfast spot in Fayetteville. If you’re looking for a finer breakfast or brunch, perhaps for a special occasion, this is the place for you. 

Facebook - Twitter


 Mockingbird Kitchen (Weekend)

📍1466 N College Ave.

Photo Courtesy of Mockingbird Kitchen

Stop at the Mockingbird Kitchen for some Modern Ozark Cuisine to start your day. Brunch is served on Saturday and Sunday from 10-2p. The kitchen has vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free options prepared with local and seasonal ingredients, so there’s something delicious and well made for everyone. 

Instagram - Facebook


 Cafe Ru Orleans (Sunday Brunch)

📍1150 N College Ave.

Photo Courtesy of Cafe Ru Orleans

Cafe Ru Orleans has been voted Best Brunch in NWA since 2004, and it’s no surprise why. The cafe serves Sunday brunch 10-2p with all the best parts of its New Orleans style cooking. Each brunch special comes with seasonal fruit and a choice of grits or jazzy potatoes. Popular items are the Creole Omelete, Shrimp & Grits, and the French Toast. 

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter


Rogers 

The Fat Chef

📍14550 AR-12

Photo Courtesy of The Fat Chef

Nestled just east of Rogers in Prairie Creek, The Fat Chef is the spot if you’re looking for that classic “mom & pop” feel with a gourmet finish. The home cooking makes for an easy morning and sets you up perfectly for an afternoon nap. For you meat lovers the Mississippi Pork is a must.

Facebook


Sam’s Olde Tyme Hamburgers

📍223 E Locust St.

📍574 E Centerton Blvd.

Photo Courtesy of Sam's Old Tyme Hamburgers

Open seven days a week, Sam’s Olde Tyme Hamburgers has your brunch needs covered. If you can make it to either of their two locations, make sure to check out their daily brunch specials, and if you get a chance try the JB Toaster Sandwich!

Facebook


Wesner’s Grill

📍117 W Chestnut St.

Photo Courtesy of Wesner's Grill

If you’re looking for your new favorite omelet place, look no further than Wesner’s Grill they have all the classics ready to go! The Downtowner is a fan favorite that everyone needs to try, check them out next time you’re in Rogers.

Facebook


Mirabella's Table (Weekend)

📍4200 S 48th St

Photo Courtesy of Mirabella's Table

Mirabella's is sister to Tavola Trattoria and Table Mesa Bistro, so you know it’s lush with yummy delights for your weekend brunch excursion. There are options for everyone to enjoy from granola and yogurt to biscuits and gravy to Bella’s brunch pizza. Everything on the menu is available to order online and pick up to take away if you’d like as well. It is located off Exit 82 in Rogers. 

Instagram - Facebook


Bentonville

 The Hive

📍200 NE A St

Photo Courtesy of The Hive

Located inside the award-winning 21c Hotel Museum, The Hive prides itself on creativity and innovation, showcasing some of Arkansas’ classic culinary features in new and exciting ways. Try the Fried Chicken and Bubbles combo (chicken & biscuits with your choice of 3 fruit juices to add to bubbly wine) or something more traditional like the French toast entree.

Instagram - Facebook


Louise

📍2205 SW I St.

Photo Courtesy of Louise

Named after Iris Louise McPhetridge Thaden, one of the greatest aviatrixes of all time, Louise Thaden serves phenomenal fresh food with incredible views of the airfield. Bring the kids for a fun morning watching the planes take off and land, or bring a book and hang out while you try the OZ1 Omelet!

Instagram - Facebook


Table Mesa (Weekend)

📍110 East W Central Ave.

Photo Courtesy of Table Mesa

After you’ve done your farmer’s market shopping, pop into Table Mesa for what might become your favorite brunch place in Bentonville! If you’re looking for a unique experience for a special occasion or just a classy morning adventure, Table Mesa’s Sunday brunch might be right up your alley. Brunch starts at 8a and ends at 11a.

Instagram - Facebook


Crepes Paulette

📍100 SW 8th St.

Photo Courtesy of Crepes Paulette

If you’re looking for something new and handheld for brunch, check out the la Classic or the la Spinach crêpes from Crêpes Paulette, or if you’re looking for something sweeter for brunch try the fan-favorite Nutella and banana crêpe! A crêpe in one hand, mimosa in the other, soaking in the sunshine, can a morning get any better?

Instagram - Facebook


 Pressroom (Weekend)

📍100 NW 2nd St.

Photo Courtesy of Pressroom

Don’t miss out on Pressroom’s weekend brunch specials, packed with options for those wanting to lean towards the breakfast side or the lunch side of brunch with fantastic shareable plates to bring the table together. Relax into Pressroom’s atmosphere and bring the whole table together this weekend.

Instagram - Facebook


Other areas around NWA

 Duffer's

📍638 W Lancashire Blvd.

Photo Courtesy of Duffer's

Now included in Bella Vista’s top 10 restaurants, Duffer’s eggs Benedict will not leave you wanting. Duffer’s is the perfect place for breakfast, especially if you enjoy the game of golf, and their brunch specials have been a favorite of Bella Vista since 1996. If you are looking for a quaint cafe with a whimsical atmosphere, look no further than Duffer’s

Facebook


Mudstreet Cafe

📍22 S Main St. G

Photo Courtesy of Mudstreet Cafe

Located in Eureka Springs’ famous “Underground”, Mudstreet Cafe has been winning awards since 1997 for its fresh food and desserts. Mudstreet Cafe serves its famous breakfast all day, with specialty food items available for take-out or dine-in. Join them for Sunday brunch and your favorite specialty coffee.

Facebook

Photo Courtesy of Mudstreet Cafe

Located in Eureka Springs’ famous “Underground”, Mudstreet Cafe has been winning awards since 1997 for its fresh food and desserts. Mudstreet Cafe serves its famous breakfast all day, with specialty food items available for take-out or dine-in. Join them for Sunday brunch and your favorite specialty coffee.

Facebook
node.title: NWA Daily's Brunch Guide
node.description: Brunch, Breakfast places in Northwest Arkansas, Springdale, Bentonville, Rogers, Fayetteville. The guide to find brunch in Fayetteville, AR, brunch in Springdale, AR, brunch in Rogers, AR, or brunch in Bentonville, AR

node.content:
If you don't already know about the extent of Northwest Arkansas' beer scene, live in the dark no longer because we have created a list of local breweries for your education and pleasure. Take part in the "Arkansas original craft beer tour" on the famed Ale Trail which covers ground all the way to Eureka Springs, or pick a new spot from below and invite your friends. Whatever may be your vibe we're just glad you're drinking local - cheers!

Rogers

New Province Brewing Company

📍1310 W Hudson Rd

Photo courtesy of New Province Brewing Company

New Province is independent and locally owned, each ounce of beer made on-site in a brewery viewable by customers who come in and drink one or a few of the available beers. Every Wednesday from 7-9p New Province hosts a trivia night and local food trucks make an appearance and add to the evening!

Facebook - Twitter


Natural State Beer Company

📍5214 Village Pkwy

NWA Daily

Natural State Beer Company is known for its "rigorous quality standards" for its beer, and multiple awards attest to the deliciousness of its ales. NSBC is easily accessible off the Razorback Greenway and not far from Pinnacle Hills Promenade, making it a perfect location for a pitstop on any type of day. We recommend trying a flight of their German ales.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter


Hawk Moth Brewery 

📍710 N 2nd St

NWA Daily

Hawk Moth is a locally owned small-batch brewery and beer parlor located in historic downtown Rogers dedicated to enhancing your experience of beer. You'll find here old-world beer styles with a modern American twist. Hawk Moth focuses heavily on barrel aging and blending as well. Our beer of choice from Hawk Moth is their Hazy IPA.

Instagram- Facebook


Ozark Beer Company

📍109 N Arkansas St

NWA Daily

Ozark Beer Company is the home of "Hard Work" and "Honest Beer." This brewery offers a variety of year-round and seasonal beers aged in the Ozark Celler. Ozark Beer Co marks another central location, just across from the Railyard, Lake Atalanta, and a few miles from Beaver Lake. Recognized by Southern Living, Men's Journal, and Food & Wine, Ozark Beer Co is a top 5 brewery in NWA.

Instagram - Facebook


Rendezvous Junction Brewing Co. 

📍2225 S Bellview Rd

Photo courtesy of Rendezvous Junction Co.

Rendezvous Junction is just that -- a junction for people brought together by great beer. It is located across from the Pinnacle Hills Promenade "crafting beer that brings taste & buds together." RJBC started out as home brews being shared with friends and evolved into a neighborhood brewery that invites people to join the TasteBuds to keep the tastes as good as they can be.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter

Bentonville

Bentonville Brewing Company

📍901 SW 14th St

NWA Daily

Bentonville Brewing is right off 14th St. in Bentonville next to Climb Bentonville. You'll find food trucks parked in the lot outside offering great grub before or after you sit down for some authentic and unique beers. Take a tour of the brewery before you try what's on tap for the whole experience. The beer is great here, but what might be better is the family environment. With an outdoor play area for kids and large beer garden, it is great for the family.

Instagram - Facebook


Bike Rack Brewing Co. 

📍801 SE 8th St

📍410 SW A St

NWA Daily

Bike Rack Brewing is Bentonville’s oldest brewery, continually crafting new ales using local inspiration and quality ingredients. If you like dark beer we recommend give the Coler Coffee Stout a try! It is a winter seasonal with espresso, crafted in collaboration with Airship Coffee. Known for its overlap with biking, you'll find beers here named Slaughter Pen, Urban Trail, and the Derailleur.

Instagram - Facebook


Bentonville Taproom

📍109 S Main St

Photo courtesy Bentonville Taproom

The Taproom in Bentonville is a state-of-the-art, family-friendly facility with play areas inside and outside as well as a dog park on-site for your four-legged furry friends. Music and events are regular affairs at The Taproom which include trivia, Euchre night, cornhole tournaments, and more. Grab food from food trucks nearby or order some German-style pub food from the kitchen inside.

Facebook


Ozark Beer at Rope Hounds

📍407 SW A St

NWA Daily

Ozark Beer at Rope Hounds is an iconic Dog-friendly taproom in downtown Bentonville right next to The Fire Truck Food Truck. The taproom features year-round, Small Batch and Pilot Batches of Ozark Beer Company’s taproom only draught. Cocktails, wine, and ciders are also on the table.

Instagram - Facebook


Social Project Brewing Co. 

📍600 SW 41st St

NWA Daily

Social Project Brewing Co. was founded on love for craft beer as well as community. If you like hop-heavy brews, you'll enjoy what Social Project has to offer. Go with friends or with the intention of meeting new ones, because in tandem with sensational beers, growing social circles is what this place is all about. They have an active rotation of beers, always trying variations. In our opinion, this might be one of the most overlooked and underrated breweries in NWA.

Instagram - Facebook

Fayetteville

Fossil Cove Brewing Co.

📍1946 N Birch Ave

Photo courtesy of Fossil Cove

The people behind Fossil Cove Brewing Co. love NWA and this little corner of the world, naming their brewery after a fossil-laden cove on the shores of Beaver Lake (the brewery's water source). They have a solid selection of 8-10 beers annually with seasonal rotations. If you're feeling like some grub, we definitely recommend a pizza from the food truck Wicked Wood Fired Pizza on site. Our beer of choice is the T-Rex or Birch Ave Blond.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter


West Mountain Brewing Co.

📍21 W Mountain St

Photo courtesy of West Mountain Brewing Co

West Mountain Brewing Co. is right next door to Tiny Tim's Pizza on the Historic Downtown Square of Fayetteville. This brewery is Northwest Arkansas' oldest brewery and has become a Fayetteville tradition with a wide selection of top-notch beers.

Facebook


Boston Mountain Brewing

📍121 W Township St

Photo courtesy of Boston Mountain Brewing

Boston Mountain Brewing offers a small in-house menu and additional offerings on the weekend. Enjoy the ever-changing array of beers throughout the week, and go on a Friday for some 99 cent wings. Hang out on the patio, and/or call ahead for a tour of the full space!

Facebook


Apple Blossom Brewing Company 

📍1550 E Zion Rd

Photo courtesy of Apple Blossom Brewing

Apple Blossom Brewing Company, named after the state flower, is the largest of its kind in the state of Arkansas with 8,500 SF of space and over 250 seats. There's a large patio, full bar, and great food so there's room for whatever time you're looking to have. It's also along the Greenway and walking distance from Lake Fayetteville trail making it a convenient location.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter


Crisis Brewing

📍210 South Archibald Yell Blvd

Photo courtesy of Crisis Brewing

Crisis Brewing is one of the more unique breweries in the area, nestled in a patch of trees almost hiding it from view in the summer months. It was named "lovingly after a midlife crisis" and created for the love of the craft of brewing and community. Crisis is the type of place only locals know about and serves up some of the best beer in the state. Hot take, this is the best beer in NWA.

Instagram- Facebook


Columbus House Brewery and Tap Room

📍701 W North St

Photo courtesy of Columbus Hous Brewery and Tap Room

Also right off the bike trail, Columbus House Brewery and Tap Room is an intimate, 3 barrel space with rotating and permanent taps run by NWA natives and University of Arkansas alum. The space is friendly and right next to Fayetteville Funky Flea Market. Columbus is perfect stop along the Ale Trail and encourages cyclist and runners to stop by at their leisure.

Instagram - Facebook

Springdale

Core Brewing & Distilling Co. 

📍N, 2470 Lowell Rd

Photo courtesy of Core Brewing & Distilling Co.

Core Brewing & Distilling prides itself in crafting beer with the diligence and pride of small-town America. If you're looking for somewhere that embodies southern vibes and hospitality, this is your place. Core is the official craft brewery of the Razorbacks and has their own beer to show for it. All in all their beer is solid, but what they might most be known and loved for is their Scarlet Letters.

Instagram


Saddlebock Brewery & Restaurant 

📍18244 Habberton Rd

Photo courtesy Saddlebock Brewery & Restaurant

On the shores of the White River, Saddlebock Brewery built a state-of-the-art and environmentally conscious brewery on a farm in Springdale. It is the first production brewery in Northwest Arkansas and is committed to brewing fine, European-style beers brewed in small batches without artificial ingredients or preservatives. These folks know how to handle the brewing process with care, and it's such a uniquely Arkansan location, you ought to give it a try.

Instagram - Facebook - Twitter
node.title: NWA Daily's Brewery Guide
node.description: Breweries in Northwest Arkansas, Breweries in Fayetteville, Breweries in Bentonville, Breweries in Springdale, Breweries in Rogers, Arkansas Breweries, Local Breweries, Ale Trail, NWA Ale Trail, craft beer in northwest arkansas. The top places for beer in northwest arkansas.

node.content:
Fayetteville

Atlas

📍208 N Block Ave, Fayetteville, AR 72701

Photo Courtesy of Atlas

Looking for a place that has it all? This is it. Atlas is the epitome of date night. Located right off the Fayetteville Square, the ambiance is perfect whether you choose to be in the lounge/bar area, dining area, or on the patio. The cocktails are delicious down to every last detail. You cannot go wrong with anything on their rotating menu, but if you see lamb chops that is our recommendation! Want to keep the night going? You can walk to Vault for a cocktail and more upscale vibes or head right across the street to Fayetteville's staple, Maxines.

Instagram - Facebook


Leverett Lounge

📍737 N Leverett Ave #1, Fayetteville, AR 72701

Photo Courtesy of NWA Daily

We love Leverett Lounge because it fits any date night vibe you're looking for. You can dress to the nines or come in athleisure... anything goes and fits right in with the eclectic atmosphere! They have a rotating menu that keeps things fresh every time you visit. Two items that stay on their menu, Mel's Diner for an appetizer (fried cheese grits) and the KFC for dinner, are our recommendations! You can expect a well crafted speciality cocktail menu, but we love their house sangria too! The pitcher is perfect to share at the table!

Instagram - Facebook


Vetro 1925

📍17 E Center St, Fayetteville, AR 72701

Photo Courtesy of Vetro

An upscale Italian spot right off the Fayetteville Square, Vetro has the regular Italian staples, but they also have some other amazing dishes. Our favorite is actually not pasta...it is the pork chop. Even if you aren’t usually a pork chop person, this one is simply divine. The food is not only fantastic, but there is also something on the menu for everyone. Our go-to drink here is the old fashioned, but they also have a long list of wines - perfect to pair with Italian food!

Instagram - Facebook


Theo's

📍318 Campbell Ave, Fayetteville, AR 72701

📍R3300 S Market St #100, Rogers, AR 72758

Photo Courtesy of NWA Daily

Known for their amazing happy hour, Theo's is perfect if you're craving a great cocktail, tasty apps, or looking to enjoy a good patio! Once you're finished with happy hour, we recommend heading inside for a nice dinner. Theo's is also fantastic way to end any evening with a delicious drink at their bar/lounge. They have two locations, one is in Fayetteville and the other is in Rogers.

Instagram - Facebook


Ella's Table

📍465 Arkansas Ave, Fayetteville, AR 72701

Photo Courtesy of Ella's Table

Looking for a romantic, cozy night? Look no further than Ella’s Table in Fayetteville. It is located at the edge of Old Main Lawn, inside of the Inn at Carnall Hall so it is perfect if you are feeling a full night away from home. You can start with dinner at Ella’s Table, enjoy Lambeth Lounge for craft cocktails, and stay the night in one of the Inn's cozy rooms. Don't forget to head back to Ella's Table when you wake up for some delicious brunch! 

Facebook - Instagram


Springdale Area

MJ Pizzeria

📍838 N 48th Street, Suite A Springdale, AR 72762

Photo Courtesy of NWA Daily

MJ Pizzeria is perfect for great food and specialty cocktails, while also keeping your night casual. This is one of the NWA Daily staff favorites because they offer fantastic pizza, but also serve wonderful salads, appetizers, and pastas! We highly recommend the Tarte Flambé Pizza and the Wood-Oven-Roasted Artichoke dip!

Facebook


The Venesian Inn

📍582 W Henri De Tonti Blvd Tontitown, AR 72762

Photo Courtesy of Venesian Inn

Venesian Inn is a classic NWA date night spot. It has been serving incredible food since 1947. They are known for their homemade spaghetti, fried chicken, and rolls, but you honestly can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The atmosphere is homey, casual, and welcoming which is a perfect touch while eating the delicious home cooked Italian food.

Instagram - Facebook


Pastafina

📍1045 E Lowell Ave, Cave Springs, AR 72718

Photo Courtesy of Pastafina

Drive on over to Cave Spring for some of the best, authentic pasta you can find in NWA. Pastafina has a cozy atmosphere with friendly welcoming staff, generous portion sizes, very affordable prices and of course delicious pasta.

Facebook


Rogers

Heirloom at 1907

📍101 E Walnut St #301, Rogers, AR 72756

Photo Courtesy of Heirloom at 1907

Heirloom is located in the heart of downtown Rogers yet hidden in the building 1907 in typical speakeasy fashion. Heirloom at 1907 is the perfect place for a special, intimate night. With enough seating for only 20 people, reservations are a must.. and sometimes they book out several months in advance, so plan ahead! Not only does it feel like a speakeasy, the food is amazing and very unique, making the whole experience something to talk about for days.

Facebook - Instagram


Local Lime

📍2103 S Promenade Blvd, Rogers, AR 72758

Photo Courtesy of Local Lime

Local Lime is a causal setting but with a fun, trendy vibe, plus has amazing food... This is an NWA Daily staff favorite! We love ordering the salsa trio, queso, and fajitas, and you definitely don't want to forget about a margarita! Truly, you can't wrong with anything on the menu. We recommend arriving early to get a table or to stroll the Promenade if there is a wait

Facebook - Instagram


120 Tapas Bar

📍120 S 2nd St, Rogers, AR 72756

Photo Courtesy of 120 Tapas Bar

If you’re dreaming of the food in Barcelona, you can now have it in NWA with this new spot in downtown Rogers. They make eating dinner an experience with a variety of different tapas to choose from. After you finish your tapas, we would recommend finishing your evening with a walk around the newly renovated downtown Rogers, get some crafty cocktails from the Foreman Bar, or check out some live music and have a delicious doughnut from Levi’s.

Facebook - Instagram


Ruth's Chris

📍3529 Pinnacle Hills Pkwy, Rogers, AR 72758

Photo Courtesy of Ruth's Chris

Located right off of I-49 in the Pinnacle area, woo your date by treating them to a classic steak dinner. Enjoy some great drinks from the bar, paired with the goat cheese dip or a seafood tower (if you’re feeling fancy). You can’t go here without ordering the amazing steaks! Ruth's Chris has an upscale vibe with a great patio.

Facebook - Instagram


Bonefish Grill

📍3201 S Market St, Rogers, AR 72758

Photo Courtesy of Bonefish Grill

Most people know Bonefish Grill by their Bang Bang Shrimp, but there are so many amazing things here. The fish is fresh and delicious, and they make some fantastic cocktails. We highly recommend the smoked old fashioned and their Chilean Sea Bass and Ahi Tuna Sashimi. For those not as interested in fish, their filets are also really tasty. They have seasonal specials and drinks, so there is always something new to branch out and try!

Facebook


Bentonville

The Hive

📍200 NE A St, Bentonville, AR 72712

Photo Courtesy of The Hive

Located in downtown Bentonville in the swanky, upscale hotel 21C, you can enjoy a cocktail and delicious appetizer at their bar or walk around the hotel lobby and check out the rotating art galleries while you wait to be seated. The food is just as good of as the art with a wide variety of options to choose from. Chef Matthew McClure has won several awards for his fresh, locally sourced food that has a southern twist. At the end of the meal, they bring out cotton candy, which is the icing on the cake.

Facebook - Instagram

 

The Preacher's Son

📍201 NW A St, Bentonville, AR 72712

Photo Courtesy of Preacher's Son

The Preacher's Son is located in a restored, historic church off of the Bentonville Square. The inside is beautiful, with stained glass windows throughout and a very open concept, while still offering a small and intimate feeling. They offer a unique but delicious menu with a long list of wine and cocktail options. After dinner, you can make your way downstairs to the speakeasy, Undercroft, or head to their rooftop patio for drinks.

Facebook - Instagram


Louise

📍2205 SW I St #100, Bentonville, AR 72712

Photo Courtesy of Louise at Thaden Field

Louise is not only a recommendation for a dinner date, but also for a breakfast or lunch date! Besides delicious food, it also comes with a show. It overlooks the runway at Thaden Airport, so you can watch planes take off and land as you are sipping a mimosa or an afternoon beer and burger. The menu has diner style options and some amazing southern style dishes. After your meal we recommend a walk at the nearby Osage Park.

Facebook - Instagram



Tavola Trattoria

📍108 SE A St, Bentonville, AR 72712

Photo Courtesy of Tavola

Tavola Trattoria is located on the Bentonville Square and offers any Italian dish you may want! They have traditional spaghetti , lasagna, and pizza, but we would recommend the Marcelo's Special (beef tenderloin, penne pasta, and pesto)! If you are going on a double date there, they have an option to serve dishes family style for a fun dining experience!

Facebook  - Instagram


Bar Cleeta

📍110 NW 2nd St #110, Bentonville, AR 72712

Photo Courtesy of Bar Cleeta

Bar Cleeta offers a wide array of delicious small plates concocted by their gourmet chef. It is the perfect place if you want and experience trying out several dishes. Additionally, there is an extensive wine list to choose from, and they even help you come up with wine pairings for the dishes you order. If you're not into wine, that's okay! Bar Cleeta also has fantastic specialty cocktails list as well.

Facebook - Instagram
node.title: Date Night Spots Around NWA
node.description: Where do you typically go for a night out in Bentonville, Rogers, Fayetteville, and Springdale? NWA Daily has put together a list of our favorite date night restaurants to add to your list!

node.content:
How big of a coffee person are you? Do you like it all dolled up, or are you a specialty coffee connoisseur? There are so many great places to get coffee around NWA, so we've compiled a list of coffee shops for you to explore and try out for yourself! Are you looking for a new place to sit and read a book? A place to work remotely? Or a coffee shop to gather with your friends and make some memories? There's a place for you, so go explore!

Did we miss your favorite spot? Send us an email here.


Bentonville

Airship Coffee

📍1000 SE 5th St

📍1300 Applegate Trail

Photo courtesy of Airship

Airship has two locations, both sell food and have alcohol on tap in addition to the specialty coffee available that hits the spot every time. The Coler location is only accessible by trail, so get your bike or walking shoes. The signature drinks are the Honey Bliss latte and the Lumber Jack.

Instagram - Facebook


Onyx Coffee Lab

📍100 NW Snd Street

📍507 SE E Street

The two Onyx locations in Bentonville are both unique in design and are worth stopping by just to experience the atmosphere. Expect to see plenty of people at the downtown location as it is the most popular. However, the second location in the Momentary museum is arguably the more cool one as a conveyer belt brings you your coffee... 👀

Instagram - Facebook


Heroes Coffee

📍124 SW 8th St

Photo courtesy of Heroes

Heroes is known for its cool double-decker seating. The stacked tables throw it back to the treehouse days -- at least it does for us. It's a great place to get work done or just hang out with friends and enjoy classic coffee and pastries. The signature latte is the "Hero."

Instagram - Facebook


Kennedy Coffee Roasters

📍2501 SE 14th St

Photo courtesy of Kennedy Coffee Roasters

Kennedy is a quirky little place with artsy tables and a big comfy couch situated in the corner overseeing the whole shop. They make fresh donuts every morning, which we recommend indulging in as you sip on your coffee. The shop has a drive through in the back in case you need a quick one to go.

Facebook


The Meteor

📍401 SE D Street

The Meteor is so much more than a coffee shop, but it has all the coffee shop vibes we love. Go for coffee, wine, or dinner. It's got it all. Caution as you approach because this is a popular cycling spot in town - if you really want to feel like a local try riding your bike to the location as a fun adventure.

Instagram - Facebook


211 cafe

📍405 S Main St

Photo courtesy of 211 Cafe

211 cafe is inside the Bentonville Public library with a round space brightly lit with natural light through the windows and skylight. There is plenty of outdoor seating for when it's a nice day. The baristas are always coming up with new drinks and they're always great. You can catch 211 at the Bentonville Farmers Market too!

Instagram - Facebook


Fayetteville

Onyx Coffee Lab

📍2418 N. Greg Ave.

Photo courtesy of Onyx

The OG - Onyx's Fayetteville location is where it all started. It is a great, quick spot for a cup of quality coffee and a reflection back at Onyx's humble beginning. Zero frills and strictly good coffee.

Instagram - Facebook


Puritan Coffee & Beer

📍205 W Dickson St

Puritan is your classic modern coffee shop with plenty of space to sit and work or play games with friends. It is in a perfect location on the top of Dickson Street with a great selection of beers and ciders too. They have a legendary trivia night!

Instagram - Facebook


Red Kite Company

📍1852 N Crossover Rd

Photo courtesy of Red Kite

A super cozy coffee shop that sells exclusively Onyx coffee. A great place to study or just hang out on the east side of town. Rumor is their expanding to Benton County soon so keep an eye out as Red Kite plans to make some moves!

Facebook


Old Pine

📍3775 Mall Ave

Photo courtesy of Old Pine

Located on a spur of the Razorback Greenway, Old Pine is a cozy spot and traditionally quieter as its a bit further from campus. On a beautiful morning their outdoor patio is the place to be. The avocado toast is a solid choice - we would recommend.

Instagram - Facebook


Arsaga's

📍481 S. School Ave

📍200 W. Center St.

📍1509 MLK Jr. Blvd

📍401 W. Mountain St.

With 4 locations in Fayetteville each Arsaga's location is a different experience. Take your friends to the Mill District and have a fancy breakfast or brunch with your coffee in an artsy cafe. Church & Center is calm and comfy, and of course Carsaga's is perfect for a quick one to-go. The fourth location just reopened and can be found in the Fayetteville Public Library.

Instagram - Facebook


Basecamp

📍2850 N College Ave

Photo courtesy of Basecamp

Originally known as Mama Carman's, now Basecamp is an open and spacious place off College with plenty of places to sit to work or catch up with a friend. They have the classic toast and pastry options too.

Instagram - Facebook


Doomsday Coffee & Roasterie

📍436 W Watson St

Photo courtesy of Doomsday

Located off West Street near downtown Fayetteville, Doomsday Coffee is owned and operated by veterans with REALLY tasty breakfast and lunch tacos. They're open 7 days a week for breakfast and lunch and are often overlooked, but shouldn't be.

Instagram - Facebook


Lift Coffee Bar

📍3959 N Steele Blvd

Photo courtesy of Lift

Located in uptown Fayetteville, Lift Coffee Bar helps meet the caffeine cravings of north Fayetteville. Open late on weekends, this is an ideal location for coffee nightcap. Definitely go with an empty stomach so you can try their delicious menu items. The waffles are great!

Instagram - Facebook


Locals Drive Thru Coffee

📍2626 E Citizens Dr

Photo courtesy of Locals Drive Thru Coffee

Locals Drive Thru Coffee serves locally roasted, specialty coffee with speed and convenience. Locals has a mission to treat everyone in such a way that they "leave better." You can get any quality coffee and specialty drink, just a little faster, and know you're contributing to a hyper local business. When you go, try the cinnamon toast crunch latte!

Instagram - Facebook


Rogers

Onyx Coffee Lab

📍101 E Walnut St

The Onyx in Rogers is the Head Quarters of all Onyx coffee. Go experience the famous hospitality of the space and baristas trained by the 2020 US Barista Champion. See how the magic happens right in the heart of downtown Rogers.

Instagram - Facebook


Heroes Coffee

📍5201 Pauline Whitaker Pkwy

Heroes in Rogers has the double-decker tables we know and love, but in a brighter and more spacious environment than the first location. The signature lattes are the "Hero," which is dark chocolate and toffee nut, and the honey salted caramel latte.

Instagram - Facebook


Iron Horse

📍220 S 1st St

Iron Horse is a hidden gem, often outshined by Onyx down the street. If you're looking for a cozy spot for just coffee or a good bite to eat as well, Iron Horse is a great option. There is an upstairs loft area with brilliant books from floor to ceiling as a perfect distraction from whatever it is you might be working on.

Instagram - Facebook


Java Dudes Coffee Co.

📍718 N 2nd St

Java Dudes is plenty spacious and well lit from the garage door windows. It has your classic coffees as well as plenty of options for you non-coffee drinkers out there, like lemonade, Kombucha, Italian Soda. Its signature latte is "The Dude," a white chocolate, hazelnut drink. For those of you 21+, there is a wine and beer selection as well.

Instagram - Facebook


Springdale

Red Kite

📍7058 W Sunset Ave

Photo courtesy of Red Kite Springdale

Red Kite sells exclusively Onyx coffee, so you are bound to get a good cup of something. There is a nice conference space, smaller half booth tables, and a long couch if you're looking for a "Friends" environment.

Instagram - Facebook


Trailside Coffee Company

📍101 W Johnson Ave

Photo courtesy of Trailside Coffee Company

Located directly on the Razorback Greenway in downtown Springdale, Trailside Coffee is perfect way to meet people on the trail! The shop serves Mountain Bird coffee with an assortment of snacks and baked goods. The outdoor seating area is surrounded by greenery, fitting the vibe perfectly.

Instagram - Facebook


Johnson

Confident Coffee Roasters

📍2015 Main Dr

Confident Coffee Roasters is one of the first coffee shops on the up-and-coming strip in Johnston. The woman-owned shop roasts its own coffee and the baristas can tell you all about every cup you drink. Their new selection of pastries are made fresh in house everyday.

Instagram - Facebook


Hail Fellow Well Met Cafe

📍5519 W Hackett Rd

Hail Fellow Well Met Cafe is another one of Onyx's lovely creations. You can get the specialty coffee you know and love in a whole new environment with more to experience. This location is unique with it's full menu of carefully crafted items all made fresh and in house. There is a market with dairy products, some fresh produce, wines, and more.

Instagram - Facebook


Siloam Springs

Pour Jons

📍516 E Main St

Photo courtesy of Pour Jons

Pour Jons is a hip place to be right on main street Siloam Springs. The coffee is hand crafted and brewed by all the best methods. And if you need a breakfast spot, or you plan on staying a while, there is a menu full of delicious breakfast and lunch options that will satisfy. If you're lucky, you might pop in on a performance on the stage inside.

Instagram - Facebook


Cafe On Broadway

📍123 N Broadway St

Photo courtesy of Cafe on Broadway

Cafe on Broadway is a coffee shop, cafe, and bar, making it a perfect stop any time of day! Though it gets pretty busy around lunch time, it's still a good spot to hang out, do work, or do school. If you're looking for a pastry with your coffee, this would be the place, as there is a fully service bakery making fresh goods every day.

Instagram - Facebook


Doomsday

📍120 US-412

Photo courtesy of Doomsday

Doomsday in Siloam Springs is located right off the highway and hard to miss. If you're looking to sit down for a nice cup of coffee and tasty lunch, you can find it here. It has a good menu too, so check it out.

Facebook


7 Brew

📍View all 12 locations HERE

Photo courtesy of 7 Brew

7 Brew is an NWA original that opened in 2017 and has thrived ever since. With 12 locations in the region, it is a quick and easy coffee run whenever you're on the go. For those of you who like fancy coffees, sodas, or teas, you'll surely find something on 7 Brew's menu.

Instagram - Facebook


The Coffee Container

📍 13511 Carrier Ln

Photo courtesy of The Coffee Container

The coffee container is just what it looks like: a coffee shop in a bright blue shipping container! Go just to say you did!

Facebook
node.title: Ultimate Guide of Northwest Arkansas Coffee Shops
node.description: NWA Daily's guide to the yummy coffee shops in Northwest Arkansas. A list of local coffee shops in Bentonville, Fayetteville, Rogers, Siloam Springs, Eureka Springs, Lowell, Tontitown, Johnson, etc.

node.content:
Find yourself craving pizza all the time but never know where you should go? We've got you covered. Northwest Arkansas is home to some amazing pizza places that span a broad range of styles and flavors. Here in NWA, we've got it all - fancy pizza, New York style, Chicago style, traditional pizza, dessert pizza, and even healthy(ish) pizzas. There are so many great places that it's hard to keep track of.

With the help of our readers, we've compiled a list of places to get pies across towns like Fayetteville, Springdale, Rogers, Bentonville, Siloam Springs, and Eureka Springs. This list is by no means all-inclusive and isn't in any order, but is grouped by city for ease of navigation. Cheers to exploring the region one pizza joint at a time!

Did we miss your favorite spot? Send us an email here.

Fayetteville

Wood Stone Craft Pizza

📍 Fayetteville (Uptown) - 3619 Mall Ave

📍 Fayetteville (S Town) - 557 S School Ave

Photo courtesy of Woodstone Craft Pizza

Located in both North and South Fayetteville, featuring fun and trendy atmospheres. They offer speciality pizzas and cocktails. Our go to is the wedge salad, Bloomington pizza, and pomegranate margarita. Don’t forget to try the bone sauces for dipping! The Uptown location has an amazing new patio addition for great outdoor dining.

Instagram, Facebook


Damgoode Pies

📍 37 E Center Street

Photo courtesy of Damgoode Pies

Fun location right off the square with a casual environment. Their traditional and specialty pies are both great, and they offer draft beer. We highly recommend the pepperoni “stuffy” with pink sauce.

Instagram, Facebook


US Pizza Company

📍 202 W Dickson Street

Photo courtesy of US Pizza

This is the ideal place for pizza after a football game. They have a great patio right on Dickson Street with homemade ranch that is to die for. The classic pizza is great, but you can also spice it up with a variety of cool flavor combinations.

Instagram, Facebook


Bocca Italian Eatery & Pizzeria

📍 2036 N College Ave

Photo courtesy of Bocca Italian

This nicer location has homemade everything! Woodfire pizza and plenty of roasted garlic! They also offer other Italian options if you want some variety.. try any of the homemade pastas or the steak!

Instagram, Facebook


Z's Brick Oven Pizza

📍 2730 N College Ave

Photo courtesy of Z's Brick Oven Pizza

Enjoy Brick Oven Pizza, delicious sandwiches, Grandmother's pasta dishes and tasty salads while dining in at Z's! The cozy fireplace is an excellent spot to enjoy beer or wine with your meal.

Instagram, Facebook


Marley's Pizzeria & Bar

📍 609 W Dickson Street #103

Photo courtesy of Marley's Pizzeria & Bar

Deep dish pizza that makes you feel like you are in Chicago. Located just off of Dickson Street, it is in the heart of downtown but slightly tucked away. The apps and wings are good too!

Instagram, Facebook


Tiny Tim's Pizza

📍 21 W Mountain Street

Photo courtesy of Tiny Tim's

Located on the Fayetteville square the thin crust pizza is amazing with great lunch portions. Don’t forget a side of their homemade ranch!

Instagram


Tim's Pizza East

📍 1813 E Mission Blvd

Photo courtesy of NWA Daily

This family owned and operated pizza joint is a staple in East Fayetteville. They are known for their pizzas being packed with flavor with lots of cheese!


Wicked Wood Fire Pizza

📍 1946 N Birch Ave

Photo courtesy of Wicked Wood Fire Pizza

This is one of the favorites in Fayetteville. Right outside of Fossil Cove, a fantastic brewery, this food truck has some of the best wood fired pizza in the area. Our favorite is the Honey Pig for the perfect balance of spicy and sweet.

*Closed on Mondays

Instagram, Facebook


Geraldi's

📍 20 S University Ave

Photo courtesy of Geraldi's

Cozy, authentic, Italian vibes. They offer thick crust pizza and calzones with plenty of other amazing options for non-pizza people.. try the lasagna or traditional spaghetti and meatballs!

Instagram, Facebook


Mellow Mushroom Fayetteville

📍 1460 E Augustine Ln

Photo courtesy of Mellow Mushroom

Located near uptown Fayetteville, they are perfect for large groups. Their thick crust pizza has a great mix of artisanal and original flavors. Half priced Pizza on Wednesdays!

Instagram, Facebook


Mojo’s Pints & Pies

📍 2630 East Citizens Dr.

Photo courtesy of Mojo's Pints and Pies

A newly opened location in East Fayetteville that offers a great patio and hearty pizzas! A great place to watch sports with a full bar and plenty of TVs - inside and out.

Instagram, Facebook


Gusano’s

📍 1267 Steamboat Dr

Photo courtesy of Gusano's

Specializing in Chicago style pizza, they have several locations scattered around NWA. They offer trivia nights on Wednesday and happy hour all day Thursday, plus additional specials offered most other days. Check out their monthly event calendar to see what fun activities are happening.

Instagram, Facebook


Tony’s New York Style Pizza

📍 412 W Dickson St

Photo courtesy of Tony's New York Style Pizza

Located on Dickson Street and staying open late on weekends makes for the perfect late night treat. Want pizza but don’t want a whole pizza? This is the place for you.

Facebook


Loafin Joe's

📍 201 W Mountain St

Photo courtesy of Loafin Joe's

Located right off of the square is this great lunch spot with amazing thin or thick crust pizza, plus hearty sandwiches if you’re not feeling pizza. Don’t forget to try their legendary homemade chips!

Instagram, Facebook


Springdale

Sassafras Springs Vineyard and Winery

📍 6461 E Guy Terry Rd

Photo courtesy of Sassafras Springs Vineyard and Winery

Cozy atmosphere with an incredible patio and great wine. They offer classic pizzas and everything you need for a fabulous charcuterie board. Wednesday you can get half priced wine if you buy a pizza.

Instagram, Facebook


MJ Pizzeria

📍 838 N 48th St Suite A

Photo courtesy of NWA Daily

The pizza here is amazing! We recommend the Tarte Flambé Pizza, as well as the full bar and fun patio. Some claim it’s the best in NWA!

Instagram, Facebook


The Odd Soul

📍 126 W Emma Ave

Photo courtesy of The Odd Soul

Located in a cool, old building right off of Emma Street, you’ll find a casual, chill atmosphere, great beer, and a pool table. Any of their pizzas can be made into a calzone! Plus, don’t forget to add the spicy honey and house seasoning!

Instagram, Facebook


Pizzeria Ruby

📍 5519 Hackett St Suite 100

Photo courtesy of NWA Daily

Head over to the new Johnson Square for this fun atmosphere that offers it all: Italian cocktails, appetizers, pizza, and gelato. They have a great patio and pizza by the slice during lunch. We highly recommend the White Pizza, traditional pepperoni or the Howdy Neighbor (made with Wright’s BBQ brisket)!

Instagram, Facebook


Gusano’s

📍 1094 E Henri De Tonti Blvd

Photo courtesy of Gusano's

See above to Gusano’s Fayetteville location. The only difference is Trivia night on Tuesday night!


US Pizza of Springdale

📍 7322 W Sunset Ave Suite A

Photo courtesy of U.S. Pizza

See above to US Pizza in Fayetteville.

Instagram, Facebook


Guido's Pizza

Springdale - 📍 4275 S Thompson St C

Tonitown - 📍 363 W Henri De Tonti Blvd

Photo courtesy of Guido's Pizza

This casual environment has classic pizzas at a great price. Plus, they have lots of other options for non-pizza people! They offer dine-in, carry-out, or delivery. Highly recommend getting Guido's delivered when you're hosting a group of friends.

Facebook


Rogers

The Rail Rogers

📍 218 S 1st St

Photo courtesy of NWA Daily

Located in Downtown Rogers you’ll find a cool environment in the perfect location! Their crust is special and they offer unique pizza options. It is the local favorite, and we see why! If you’re not up for pizza, the pork shanks and wings are a favorite here!

Facebook


Old Chicago Pizza

📍 1900 W Pleasant Grove Rd

Photo courtesy of Old Chicago Pizza

Although you may find Old Chicago in other states, this is the only Arkansas location. It is great for groups and has a Happy hour from 3-6pm.

Instagram, Facebook


Bariola’s Pizzeria

📍 1728 S 46th St #101

Photo courtesy of Bariola's Pizzeria

The laid back atmosphere is perfect for an evening of watching sports and using the arcade. Their classic pizza has crispy crust AND they offer free ice cream.

Instagram, Facebook


Artisan Wood Fired Kitchen

📍 2203 S Promenade Blvd

Photo courtesy of Artisan Wood Fired Kitchen

Take a break from shopping and have some pizza at the Promenade. Neapolitan inspired dough is made daily and cooked in wood fired ovens imported from Italy. And for dessert, you should try the nutella calzone!

Instagram, Facebook


Gusano’s

📍 2603 W Pleasant Grove Rd #112

Photo courtesy of Gusano's

See above to Gusano’s Fayetteville location. The only difference is Trivia night on Tuesday night!

Instagram, Facebook


Bentonville

Oven & Tap

📍 215 S Main St #3

Photo courtesy of Oven & Tap

This is an NWA Daily top pick! The owners’ attention to detail in the atmosphere, menu, and ingredients are noticed throughout the dining experience. Starting with cocktails and appetizers is a must! (Hello, Pimento Cheese and Edamame!) Save room for their amazing pizzas (you can’t go wrong with the famous Sweet Joe)! This is the perfect spot for date night or an evening with friends.

Instagram, Facebook


Pedaler's Pub

📍 410 SW A St

Photo courtesy of NWA Daily

Fun, laid back atmosphere with a great patio… perfect stop on your bike ride! They offer thin crust, wood fire pizza and have a full list of yummy appetizers and drinks!

Instagram, Facebook


Priato Pizzeria

📍 211 NE A St

Photo courtesy of Hangry Peddler

This food truck is located in the heart of Downtown Bentonville. We highly recommend on a nice day. These artisan-crafted, Neapolitan-style pizza are made fresh and fast.

Facebook


Johnny Brusco’s New York Style Pizza

📍 ​​700 SE Walton Blvd #10

Photo courtesy of Johnny Brusco's

These New York style pizzas are great for dine in, carry out, or delivery. On Tuesdays, catch the $1 cheese slice after 4pm.

Facebook


Tavola Trattoria

📍 108 SE A St

Photo courtesy of Tavola Trattoria

Known for their amazing italian pastas, people usually pass over the pizza offering… don’t be a victim to this and try the Tavola and the U District Pizza. You also can’t go wrong with their classic Margherita. They are located in the heart of downtown Bentonville.

Instagram, Facebook


Slice

📍 115 NW 2nd St

Photo courtesy of NWA Daily

New kids on the block and definitely worth a visit. They offer New York style pizza with dough and sauce homemade daily from a family recipe. This food truck is located right next to Bentonville Dive so you can enjoy a slice of delicious pizza with a cold beer.

Instagram


Loafin Joe's

📍 801 SE 8th St

Photo courtesy of Loafin Joe's

A food truck at 8th Street Market near downtown Bentonville. See above description of Loafin Joe's in Fayetteville to see more details

Instagram, Facebook


Siloam Springs

Fratelli's Wood Fire Pizza

📍 118 S Broadway St

Photo courtesy of @kruttles

Located in Downtown Siloam Springs you can find Italian style, wood fired pizza with fresh ingredients and fun toppings… lots of unique pizzas to try. Bonus, there is no better way to top off a your Italian pizza experience than with a great selection of local beers and delicious gelato.

Instagram, Facebook


TJ's Pizza

📍 8634 4290, 4290 US-412

Photo courtesy of TJ's Pizza

When dessert pizza is an option, you know all rules go out the window. Enjoy their classic pizza with homemade sauces anytime, but if you’re into wings, you should plan to go on Wednesday for wing night (a crowd favorite)!

Facebook


Eureka Springs

Cafe Amore

📍 2070 E Van Buren

Photo courtesy of Cafe Amore

A quaint, Italian restaurant in a town full of charm. Chef Katherine makes her own pizza dough and sauce daily. Highly recommend the Cheezy Garlic Bread, “The Works” pizza, and honestly all of their desserts.

Instagram, Facebook


Hotboxx Woodfire Pizza

📍 102 State Hwy 187

Photo courtesy of Hotboxx Woodfire Pizza

Pizza is served from a wood burning pizza oven and seating is available right by the lake for beautiful views. In addition to pizza, Hotboxx offers pepperoni rolls and garlic knots (both recommend!).

Facebook
node.title: Ultimate Guide of Northwest Arkansas Pizza Places
node.description: NWA Daily's guide to the yummy pizza in Northwest Arkansas. A list of local pizza restaurants in Bentonville, Fayetteville, Rogers, Siloam Springs, Eureka Springs, Lowell, Tontitown, Johnson, etc.
